review: The gameplay is essentially just 3 with a lot of new guns (and an auto-crossbow which is easily the best thing ever), but that's hardly a bad thing. The story is nothing special but it is better than Far Cry 3, I didn't hate the player charcter this time around. Pagan Min is fantastic, while he's basically just a more realistic Hansome Jack, it still works. If you're willing to deal with uplay (not that big a deal, but inconvenient) you should get it.

review:
'Looks like Far Cry 3' . Believe me its much better. Trying to find all those lost letters, MG journals and masks; discovering all ?s, it is amazing exploration experience. If you wanna do something crazy, try the Shanath Arena at hardest difficulty, it may seem easy at the beginning, but as you reach the higher levels, final rounds become totally vicious.
Hunting is hard mostly, except you are using a signature (Buzzsaw for example makes it sooo easy)
Bell towers are guarded in Northern Kyrat (some are heavily) and quite challenging to reach the top.
Outposts are not that easy to liberate. Fortresses turn into high quality action movie if you are noticed by your enemies, even the dogs.
Hunters are dangerous. It is great to have a sneaky enemy like that.
Eagles, rhinos, demon fishes and honeybadgers are completely annoying, but it makes the game even better.
You can ride an elephant and bash your enemies. 
Only thing annoying for me is distance optimization. That map cannot be 8k meters from one end to the other. It is at least 20k and distance is shown correctly if it is short but long distances are totally incorrect.
If I could explore himalayas as much as I did in Kyrat and distances were correctly calculated, this game would be 10/10.
Now it is 9/10 as they release DLC missions in Himalayas.
Hunting, bomb defusing, eye for an eye, assasination,armed escort and golden path supplies missions are also great but nothing extraordinary (except hunting for supplies)
Characters except Ajay (I did not like him, Jason Brody would be amazing in this game) are nearly perfect.
Far Cry is an idea of letting you explore the new world they created in every single aspect. If you love open world games that does not come to an end easily, this is the game you've been looking for. Trust me!

review:
A nice DLC pack nothing else, it's quite disturbing how little new content is achieved in a whole new title. You pay £40($60) for a new map, albeit a pretty map, but never the less a new map. New weapons are few and far between with most weapons of all types being direct imports from Far Cry 3, for the first have of the game nearly all weapons are direct cones or reskins. Skills..... once again shockingly for a NEW game nearly all the "perks or skills"are reused from Far Cry 3 which is disapointing. 

All in all this game could have been so much and it had so much potential but it was wasted by a lazy game developement company. Still a fun game....because it is Far Cry 3

review:
If you liked FC3, this game is for you. If you diddn't like FC3, Well i think the choice is obvious.

The story is garbage, apperantly it was written when people still thought ISIS were brave rebels fighting the evil syrian government, so basically you fight FOR indian ISIS. The individual rebels are pretty nice guys, but the generals Amita and Sabal are both tools. It's a real bummer you can'r Rebel and take down the golden path. The radio host is pretty annoying too. He keeps dickriding obama, and telling us that we need to get rid of guns in a country full og psychopathic rhinos, corrupt government forces and evil spirits that melt with a 9mm to the face. So, if you nightly watch the daily show and aren't infuriated by the half stories you hear, you shouldn't really have a problem with it.

Then we get to your character, Ajay Ghale. He has no character. Similar to Jason Brody, he really has no character. Is this a bad thing? Looking at every other character in the game save for Pagan, no. This way, he's not ruined.

If you diddn't like crafting in FC3, i got bad news for ya. In FC4, there are animals that only appear in the 2nd half. And that's not even including the special animals. It's really annoying having to be low on ammo all the time for half the game, or not have enough explosives as you'd need  because clouded lepoards won't appear.

Enemy troops are a alot tougher. In FC3, i don't remember them gunbutting you flat onto your butt, which these ones will do anytime you get within 5 feet of them. Then you have a standing up animation that takes away your ability to fire for 1 second after standing up, in which case you will of lsot half your health. If you remember the heavy gunners, they're now all over. And 1/3rd through the game, their helmets are part of their outfit, so you can no longer knock it off for an easy headshot.

There's a new enemy type that charms animals, can't be tracked, can see you through foliage and shots arrows that hurt like sniper rifle bullets. Have fun with that!

Weapon wise, there's a few additions, like a webley and a mauser, Most weapons still have terrible addition restrictions nerfing them into neigh unusability(No supp. for SVD, Only 1 add-on for SG550, ect). There's patches avaliable on a quick google search, but still. The new weapons range from useful like the MG42, the auto-crossbow, the compound bow and the new grenade launcher, to useless like the Webley and the Mauser. Hit detections gets a bit iffy at times too. I can't even count how many times i've lined up a clean headshot only to have ot phase through.

Animals in the game are OP as crap. a honey badger can take 10 5.56mm rounds to the face before it goes down. Headshots aren't 1-hit kills unless they're large calibur, It's frustrating to say the least. They also added cliffracers in the form of eagles. Have fun with that!

There's alot more options in the game now for predator gameplay. You can now throw bait to make a predatory animal spawn such as a tiger or a honey badger, You can ride elephants, you can throw knives for a semi-long distance takedown, You can move bodies as to not tip off enemies, or make a bodypile. Grenades can be toggled to be sticky, as can C4 and Proxy mines(VERY useful!) The wingsuit is avaliable almost immediatly and us utilized oftenm and there's an auto-chute deploy feature! No more stupid  foot fall deaths!

All in all, this game is an improved version of FC3. The only thing FC3 had that this game doesn't was a much better no-syringe heal system, as in you could almost fully heal with one arm-wrap. This is a very good game

All in all, i'd reccomend this game. 8/10,

review: I've put in almost 100 hours on this game, and will continue to play.  This is the best game I've played in a very long time.  The game is extremely playable, fun, great voice acting, awesome storyline and extremely re-playable.  There is only a little pathing in the story, just to keep up with the story line and have game continuum.  Even in that path though you have choices and different paths you can take that change the story and it's outcome.  And there are so many side stories and side quests to keep the action as interesting as you want it to be.  Highly recommended!  I hope the voice actors are nominated for awards on this one!

review:
Farcry 3.5? Not really. It IS everything I loved about Far Cry 3, but better. I'd say this is a proper sequel, but a "safe" one.  It doesn't change the gameplay, but instead it adds more things to do.

The concensus is that the story of Far Cry 3 was more compelling - I agree. I just don't feel the same for Ajay Ghale as a I did for that other guy. Also, the choices you make throughout the game feel like they have very little impact except for the moment in which you make them. 

Far Cry 4 is still a great game. There are still outposts to conquer, with new larger outposts called strongholds. They added a controversial "buzz copter" to the game, which is a mini-helicopter. Personally, I loved the addition and made plotting my attack on outposts more enjoyable. In fact, the entire game has an added verticality - it takes place in a mountainous environment which allows for rope climbing and longer wingsuit flight.

Unfortunately, I haven't had a chance to try out the co-op, but taking down outposts with your friends sounds amazing. Also, with the addition of user-made maps there is a huge number of things to do outside of the regular game.

Lastly, if you have the computer for it: this game is the most gorgeous game I've played in a while. At 1440p 60+ fps it's breathtaking.

review:
So this is what the ac black flag team been doing.

This game I got immersed in right of the bat , exploring every corner to hunt game to upgrade my gear , the missions are very diverse and I feel immersed in what ever I am doing at the time , the politics and tensions do play a nice role but it is kind of a bummer --spoiler alert-- but nothing you do seem to change the situation for anyone in the country regardless of who's ideals you follow, at the end you feel like the country would be better off if you simply stayed in the room where Pagin told you to stay. - I do hope this gets addressed in  future dlc's 

But the ride was fun and incredibly detailed even the side quest into shangri la was awesome!!!! 

For the bad - 
Taking towers is easy (with a buzzer you can practically do anything)
Taking bases are easy - especialy once you get the sniper rifle
Taking strongholds - Easy I found some outposts harder to knock down

Side-quests should be disabled when you are trying to take a base, I am sick and tired of a hostage taking dumb@ss running into me revealing my position 

Good game and the only thing that made my AC unity purchase worth while

review:
Pros:
- Great voice acting
- Graphics are great on all settings (Low - Ultra)
- Idle dialogues for enemies are funny
- Cutscenes are fun to watch
- The hunting is great
- The weapons are very fun to play with and use
- Sounds for the animals, guns, vehicles etc.. are awesome
- Gyrocopters

Cons:
- 30FPS capped cutscenes
- AI has super vision (Can make it more immersive but can also be irritating)
- Cutscenes can sometimes have audio errors where no audio is played
- Sometimes your wingsuit won't have the prompt to use it and sometimes it will
- Story is quite a bit more abstract than FC3

9/10
Worth $60; any cheaper would be a deal.
Ubisoft did work

review:
Bigger, richer, more dynamic, and with much more powerful weapons, Far Cry 4 excells over Far Cry 3 in all the areas that count from the standpoint of software development and yet none of the ones that made Far Cry 3 an engrossing experience from the perspective of story.
Fans of Skrillex will be disappointed, instead you get to listen to a dance craze that is neither dancy nor crazy during a decidedly less interesting mission to destroy a concrete wall.
The game meanders through a deeper and longer storyline than Far Cry 3 but will not impress those here to engage in an interesting story.  The fourth installment of the Far Cry series ditches backstory in favor of plopping you down in a massively vertical mountain environment, knifing bandits, killing animals and people with a bow, and ambushing enemy strongholds with C4.  Maybe that's what really matters.
In the end, Far Cry 4 is worth playing if you loved the tagging, bagging, knife throw takedowning, and .50 caliber sniper rifling of Far Cry 3 but with more mountains and these cute little choppers you can drop grenades on rhinos from.  In sum, a win for gameplay and graphics but a miss for story and dubstep.

review:
Bug at Act 2 (black screen). I have played like 30 hours just to be bloqued around 55% of game completion.
Currently, I can't recommend this : I can't play the main campaign missions anymore.

I can close my eyes on some minors bugs, but this one makes me unable to move on in the story.

Saw some posts about that matter, apparently Ubisoft is working on a fix. They seem to have said that it may take 1 month. Gonna wait for the fix and it better will go smooth.

This is a shame. But still, I enjoyed the game so fare (first Far Cry that I play).

review:
As a long time fan of the FC games my hopes were really high. But from the very start I had issues with this game.

At the first run the game only worked in 4:3 mode. After some try and error I finally got it to run on 16:10 but there was still huge black bars on both the top and bottom of the screen. Sometimes the game would only display a black screen once started.
This game was obviously designed to run on console. The mouse control  feels like it is created as an after thought for the games PC version.  

The game is not bad but I was simply waiting for something so much more. The graphics are good but not amazing, the world is beatiful but nothing we haven´t seen before. There is no real innovation in this game. If you have played FC3 you will be straight at home (and bored) with this game. 

The best thing about this game is the co-op mode. It is huge fun to go through the land with a friend just tearing a hole  in Pagan Min´s forces. If you do not play co-op (or have no friends) my suggestion would be to buy FC3 as it is cheaper, has almost exactly the same content and somehow I find the world much more ineteresting.

review:
One of the most "finished" ubisoft titles of 2014, Far Cry 4 continues the franchise in the himalayan mountains in the war-torn region known as Kyrat where Ajay Ghale returns to his parents home to spread his mothers ashes. Upon arriving he is stopped by the incredibly flamboyant Pagan Min and his army. Ajay soon has a heshen bad removed from his head to be in Pagan Pins fortress, kindly offered a serving of Crab Rangoon, but Ajay's guest isn't so lucky and is taken away. Shortly after you're asked to stay put, but being held by somebody who you're not sure if your anus is safe it might be the best time to be smuggled out by the locals.

Fun characters, impressive visuals, some very cool weapons once you finish the game, it seems like all positives in this exceptionally fun game. Sadly the game becomes repetetive and boring after about the 75% campaign completion mark. This was one of my gripes for Far Cry 3, but because the world was so well done with some much to do you don't ever notice it in Far Cry 4, until the home stretch is in sight. I will however mention the music in the final mission was fantastic.

It uses the same engine as Far Cry 3, you may not tell the difference until you play it. With this said it is very different and more refined than Far Cry 3, however I would be unforgiving if Ubisoft were to do the same with Far Cry 5. There's a 'Blood Dragon' spinoff in the works for Far Cry 4 which I'm looking forward to and some DLC which I plan on getting.

Far Cry 4 holds an interesting story in an interesting location, but there's much more pointlessness to the story because in any ending the story doesn't change and you can just kill everybody who drives the story after it's complete. I confess, I would have loved to be able to visit the mountains and prison again on demand, but it seems this will only happen via DLC and paying more money. So in a vast open world experience in a modified version of Far Cry 3's engine we reep the same results regardless of our choices and being limited to your location even once you finish the game. Open world only implies you can go where you want when you want, with risk of being killed by the locals or wildlife. Unfortunately Ubisoft have locked you to the confines of areas you've unlocked and anything past that you'll see "you're leaving the mission zone", "this is a dangerous area, turn back" ect and because of these small problems as well as altitude limitations the gameplay feels as though Ubisoft have cheaped out on the expansiveness of this game. You shouldn't be surprised though, every Ubisoft title comes with these problems.

Other problems include compatibility and optimization when using higher graphical settings and presets. Again there's another ongoing problem with Ubisoft and SLI, but let's not go there again. It's extremely demanding for what it is due to bad optimization, as if Ubisoft don't really care for us PC gamers, but again this is nothing new. Once you've found the best configuration for your machine, you'll be on your way. I do believe this game is a great benchmarking tool, I've recieved up to 70% GPU usage on both graphics cards once the driver was modified for SLI and identified a shortage of power delivery to be fixed this week.

Though this review seems oddly negative, it simply can't add much positivity to it's predecessor. It is insanely fun, and I forgive Ubisoft for simply re-releasing an old product with a new engine, new maps and story etc. I will not be forgiving if Far Cry 5 follows the same trend on a yearly release. It would be wise of them to slow down release times to get everything perfect.

Buy this game, it is worth your money. Don't pay a dime over $60 though, it's not worth that much.

Ajay soon has a heshen bad removed from his head to be in Pagan Pins fortress, kindly offered a serving of Crab Rangoon, but Ajay's guest isn't so lucky and is taken away. Shortly after you're asked to stay put, but being held by somebody who you're not sure if your anus is safe it might be the best time to be smuggled out by the locals.

Fun characters, impressive visuals, some very cool weapons once you finish the game, it seems like all positives in this exceptionally fun game. Sadly the game becomes repetetive and boring after about the 75% campaign completion mark. review:
It feels like Far Cry 3 reloaded but worth it. I love that they changed outpost liberating into a challenge mission with points instead of just resetting all of them.  Considering starting over and playing again even though I have 20 other games I need to play. Graphical and audio glitches here and there, often remedied by warping to another part of the map.
10/10

review:
Highly recommend. If you enjoy playing a sandbox type of game however with mini goals and a guide line to follow, then this is the game for you. 75 SGD well spent for me. 
Highly recommend players to start by capturing as much radio tower as possible to unlock a better sniper rifle with silencer equiped. 
For me personally, i'm currently around 50% progess of the game, i have quite a smooth way with my fav loadout, which is a preimer shotgun, a 50 cal sniper, a bow with upgraded sights and a handheld grenade launcher as my secondary weapon. 

Overall, if you are looking for an adventurous game? Welcome aboard. 11/10

review: This looks great... but it doesn't work. I meet the minimum requirements by a long shot and the game crashes on startup. I've looked through countless forums and tried everything I came across... and ... still nothing.  The fact that I even have to bother only serves to prove that Ubisoft has failed to deliver the product that I paid for. Even the Uplay forums have shown that their customer support isn't taking any responsibity and have continuously blamed customer hardware instead of admitting that this is a garbage port. I should'nt have to go through this in the first place. The game should just work as advertised as I've NEVER had this kind of problem before. Between Watchdogs, AC Unity and this all being an extreme hassle... I won't be buying any Ubisoft products in the future. As an avid gamer and a fan of the AC and FarCry series it pains me to say that they simply don't give a shit about their PC customers. So why should I give a shit about their products. I'm done.

review: I've been playing FarCry since the orginal and man oh man has it come a long way. This game has me engaged in the story, thje mechanics are awesome, and the missions feel a lot less go to this point, pick up an item, and then go back to where you started. Despite some graphical issues with the game (thanks Ubisoft) causing some texture popping and screen tearing I've had it for 5 days and logged so many hours and I'm just over half way through. A buy for those considering it.

review:
A lot has been said about Far Cry 4 already. The game is awesome and it was extremely fun to play throughout, but the story is very hollow and the villain is uneventful. If you're looking for a story-driven experience, stick to Far Cry 3, which has a way better script and actually leaves you thinking about the future of the guy you´ve been controlling for hours (also, it has sharks). I will be waiting for Far Cry 5, hoping for a strong story, characters I give a damn about and the awesome immersion FC4 provides.
What makes FC4 so entertaining is the world. It´s alive in a way few other games have managed, the amount of things that can kill you out of nowhere is huge and it really makes you be aware of your surroundings at all time or you'll be caught in the middle of a showdown between a bear, some tigers and a couple of terrorists :D

review: Let me start off by saying that this game looks beautiful however its riddled with glitches, FPS issues, random minimizing with epic crashing, graphical tearing etc......  I just want to enjoy farcry 4 but I can't even play it without some sort of crash!  I have a GTX 980 soooo whats the big deal then........ review:
short answer: This is to FarCry3 as the Shivering Isles was to Oblivion. This is a new map with literally everything except the storyline the same. It's DLC and should be $20

Sligtly elaborated:
You could buy FarCry 3 and you wouldn't know the difference except the storyline getting much worse in 4. You're here to spread your mother's ashes, and immediately become a ruthless killer, stabbing anyone in your way with a machete? The guns and animations are exactly the same, the graphics are about the same, concept is the exact same (liberate towers, kill everyone in an outpost before they sound the alarm, random enemies driving around until you liberate the area). Seriously, it is the exact same game minus the main missions but including side missions. The devs were incredibly lazy with the copy+pasting.

Coop is a joke.  I learned if Ubisoft made it, and they say "Coop." It won't be "Full Coop" but "half-coop," just like AC series... Paid 60$ for this game to find out me and my room-mate can't do story mode together.  But next year with Far Cry 5? They will add the extra inch of 3/4 coop. Sorry guys, I won't pay for your games any longer until you give us the full amount what the consumer wants.  Go Indie!

review:
After I played far cry 3 then I play 4, the game has feels strange a bit but you will go in atmosphere quickly. 

+ Elephants
+ Sidearms like auto-crossbow and mini grenade launcher
+ Helicopter
+ Choosable paths

- Multi-action buttons
- Long mission Checkpoints 
- Lots of side activities drive away you from story
- Weak characters except Pagan Min

If you like fps/action games and ofcourse if you like farcry you must buy the game.

9/10

review:
Well to start ill say i loved Far Cry 3 so was really looking forward to this game. And while it is still a great game it did leave me feeling a bit dissappointed. In the game you play Ajay Ghale who at the beginning of the game is returning to his birthplace of Kyrat to scatter his mothers ashes and quickly finds himself caught up in a civil war between the Golden Path and the dictator of Kyrat, Pagan Min. 

As a location Kyrat isn't bad. It modelled on Nepal so you have a pretty mountainous area this time round as opposed to the tropical islands of FC3. The gameplay hasn't changed much either with stuff like hunting, outposts and towers making a return as well as the story missions. Some new additions include being able to ride elephants (which is fun), bow and arrow (which is admitedly useful esp for hunting) and a grappling hook (good idea considering the terrain in the game but feels a bit clumsy sometimes.) 

In terms of story though this is where the game falls flat on it's arse as it just isn't very interesting and feels like background noise. Most of the main characters are pretty dull. Even Pagan Min is a dissappointment but Vaas is a hard act to follow. Most of the story missions are pretty dull and irritating as well particularly the ones that require going to the Himalayas as they are pretty linear and a lot of missions try to force you to play a certain way instead of giving you the freedom to choose your own method. One interesting new feature with the Golden Path missions is the choice between two missions between the rival leaders of the Golden Path, Amita and Sabal which makes you decide who you want to side with.

Most of the fun in this game is to be had away from the story however. There's plenty of side missions a lot of which are more entertaing than the story ones and theres plenty there to keep you occupied as well.

The game does have multiplayer which i briefly tried and while it does try something a bit different with one team armed with bow and arrows and a cloak ability, and the other armed with guns it didn't interest me much. Theres also coop for the campaign which i didnt try.

The Good:
-has a lot of the fun stuff to do outside the story
-has a couple of decent new features
-great new environment

The Bad:
-dull story and characters
-story missions are too linear and not a lot of fun

Overall this is a great game that ultimately didn't impress me as muchas its predecessor but still manages to be enjoyable. Worth picking up particularly if you liked FC3. If you didn't give this a miss. 8/10

review: Great graphics, but oh so boring! This game is so stupidly easy it almost plays itself. It's like the developers wanted to ensure the player is invincible at all times and never loses. This seems to be a fashion in game design these days. You can just stop fighting in the middle of a battle and most times nothing will happen to you. You don't have to craft - it does that for you. You don't have to consider what to loot and sell - it does that for you. You don't even have to drive the freaking cars - it does that for you! You can magically pull players out of the air to help you do anything. You can can magically make animals show up and go after the enemy. This game may as well be running in god mode full time because that's exactly what it plays like. One has to be a moron to not win every scenario first time... but I'm already so bored with it I'm going to uninstall it and regain the space. Buy this if you can't handle failure.

review:
So just to perfectly clear this review will have spoilers.







Well I just finished the game and I have to say the ending actually made me feel sick to my stomach.  Let me explain.  Sabal and Amita I did not like either one of them and I kinda wish that Ajay could have made his own choice and not followed either one of those two.  They were polar opposites but both of them were douche bags for real.  Pagan Min is awesome though his whole character the part he played in your life, your moms, and dads was actually really important I wanted to join his side once I found out everything that was going on.  I would have loved the choice to join him in the game and go kill Amita and Sabal.  Once you get to the end and find out what was going on I feel so very sorry for Pagan Min not that he would want Ajays sympathy.

At the very end when he gets on the helicopter and starts to fly away I blew it up and it actually made me feel nauseated when the horn blew and the words on the screen said THE KING IS DEAD.  There is I feel a deep and meaningful story here in this game but it makes you work to find and understand it.  I am not saying Pagan was innocent I am just saying i think in the end he was a lesser of the evils.
GG WP

review:
A corporate game, made to make money.  The passion in the fanchise is gone. 

Far Cry 3 was my favorite game for a long time; I enjoyed every bit of content provided, especially enjoying the co-op play.  I  pre-ordered Far Cry 4, followed all the development, and was truly excited for another foray into guerilla warfare.  

My disappointment is in Ubisoft.  Far Cry 4 is just a franchise game now, similar to other franchise games.  The novelty has worn off.  It's the same type of game as Far Cry 3, just more weapons and a bigger map.  I swear, I also encountered areas with the same game design, just different textures, as if the developers copied and pasted things from Far Cry 3.  

The co-op in Far Cry 4 sucks.  You can't chat with the other open world co-op player, and you can't see their handle because you have to fucking to through some stupid Uplay shit, rather than Steam.  This is just another corporate money-maker.

I won't be buying Far Cry 5, 6, or 7.  You broke my heart.

review:
So iv played this franchise since the beginning.

with that being said, this is NOT a bad game however its no far cry 3

this game is basically a mixture of 2 and 3, there are a few things they brought back a few are:

killing convoys
choosing a side in the campaign which then reflects how the game plays out 

If your walking into this game and expecting a better or on par story as 3 you are not going to get it. 
Vass and hoyte were just to good to top and the whole story in general was just better

This doesnt make the game hoirrilbe they polished all the mechanics and graphics. They built on the things that worked added a few things from 2 that were not bad, 

i would reccomand this game more things happen travelling from point A to B and the gyro helli is pretty awesome as well

review:
Far Cry 4, Feels like Far Cry 3, Which is great.

The fourth installment in an excellent game line takes you to Kyrat, In search for the location to place your mother's ashes. Along the way you run into the "villian" Pagan min, whom you just can't prevent loving. He takes on a lot of characteristics of Vaas from #3, which became infamous among the gaming community. Min, The flamboyant Villian, Hates everyone but you. You're special to him. Why? Find out yourself. You can't pass by this game. 

You can fight through the whole country, to liberate the people from min's reign, finally defeating min in a dramatic, bloody battle, or you can do what nobody else does. Sit when he says sit, and beat the game in 5 minutes. I suggest the bloody option, More guns, and explosions. We all love explosions.

Far Cry 4 is an evolutionary step forward for the franchise, improving on nearly all aspects of its predecessor which results in a far better title overall. The decreased development time between Far Cry 4 and its predecessor shows that Ubisoft has settled on a formula for the franchise one which, in my mind, seems to be working quite well for them. There are still some rough edges however, ones that I’m sure can be smoothed  out with further polish, and hopefully the next instalment in the series can get the story right which would greatly elevate the franchises station within the open world genre. All that being said Far Cry 4 is still a solid game, even for people like me who typically aren’t fans of the genre.

Read my full review here: http://www.therefinedgeek.com.au/index.php/2015/01/23/far-cry-4-im-very-particular-with-my-words/

review: Wow, I have been looking for a game similar to fallout3/Skyrimm for years and I stumbled on this gem.  I wasn't expecting much considering I find most FPS type games too much hack and slash and too little adventuring with very little in the way of escaping the usual built in linearity.  This game breaks all thoses stereotypes for me and I love it.  Sort of like the perfect balance of Fallout3, Assassin's Creed, and GTA.  Awesome game, would recommend it too anyone who likes any of the games I have mentioned.

review:
Great game solo, Co-op is a mess that you have to do so much to get a friend to join.

I'm a go getter when it comes to games like this but when you can unlock basicly everything quickly, kinda defeats the purpose of exploration.

I believe games should be based like they were in older days and not have Pay-To-Win options but you're seeing more of it and why some games don't get liked for a long time.

The bullet goes right through him. Then you shoot him again and it does the same thing untill he finally dies but you would have to sacrifice more than 1 magazine which I roughly calcluated to been shooting 40 bullets at 1 enemy (1 assault clip and a bit more so your forced to reload). You can lose alot of time fighting this 1 enemy while you have 5 to 10 enemies on you which makes you die pretty easy.

review:
When reading this please keep in mind that I love Far Cry 3 and spent probably around 150 hours in it. I've beaten the story 2 times, I conquered all outposts dozens of times and I've got the max level in MP. I reached the point now where I am totally done with FC3, and ready for FC4. I played FC4 now for around 30 hours, but I'm already done with it because I am so disappointed.

If a game series is moving on to a new chapter, then I personally expect some kind of progress in the basic gameplay while keeping the good moments and the atmosphere of a game-series. This is my main complaint about FC4: the lack of progress. The thing which made FC3 awesome was that the developers really tried to take the criticism of Far Cry 2 to heart and create a great new gaming experience. 

In FC4 I can't see anything of this. It's FC3 in a new setting, telling basically the same kind of story and fails to add some significant gamechanging features. The basic-gameplay (movement, gunplay, driving, flying, etc.) is a total rip of the predecessor, with all good and bad. Similar thing with the features: exploring, hunting, leveling, side missions, enemies - mostly the same stuff as before, most of the time worse then FC3 (Hunting is totally the same, only 2 skill trees left with a few more "skills", some new sidemissions, only one new type of enemey, ~70% ripped weapons, ...). 

The story isn't as good as FC3. The FC3-story itself wasn't extremely good, but basicly ok and lived by the great characters. FC4 also tries to create some interesting characters, but fails to compare to FC3 yet again. 

The technical side of the game is well-done. Kyrat is a beautiful setting, the graphics are as impressive as the sounds (nice music, great weapon sounds, good synchro). I haven't noticed any bugs so far. Only complaint here is the very ugly menu and some of the controls, which is caused by the console-port. One big plus is that you can play everything except the story-missions in coop. I can't say much about MP because i'm really not up for it anymore.

FC4 might be a good game standing by itself, but compared to the progress FC3 made after FC2 this is a total shame. If you are going to say that Battlefield 4 is Battlefield 3.5, then you also have to say that FC4 is FC3.2. After I finished FC3 I was really up for a new game experience, but this isn't it - only a new setting and some extremly disappointing features doesnt justify 60€ or the "4" behind "FC". Feels like an addon, so why sell it as full-price? Next time, Ubisoft, take one or two years more and then release a game which really brings the series to a new level.

If you never played the FC-series before, get FC3. If you did, then don't spent more then 30€.

review: By far the worst Far Cry game to date. Takes what made 3 so good and opts to ruin it by just being irritating and ridiculous. Animal attacks are so common you will spend half your ammo defending yourself every 100m. Enjoy the pleasures of getting stun locked by a yak, or instakilled by a stealth rhino. Far Cry 3s intresting drug sequences become Yogi's ridiculous idiocy. Storyline that is just bad, and leaves you wondering why you are fighting at all. Ridiculously obvious backstabbing that you are powerless to stop over and over again.

review:
A solid addition to the series, and personally my favourite. Kyrat is an open, exciting and engaging world with more then enough to keep you on your toes. Graphics are gorgeous and the gameplay is smooth - have not had any issues. The only downfall for me is that I thought the storyline was fairly weak, but the countless challenges and scenario's you get caught up in provide endless hours of entertainment, enough to distract yourself from the story and focus on other elements in the game. Hunt or be hunted!

Far Cry 4 has given me great memories and I highly rate this for anyone to try.

review: After a rocky start when the game first came out, I`ve found this to be as equally enjoyable as Farcry 3. Overall Graphics are spectacular and the open world environment is second to none. Although there are still a few glitches with the game, I think that they can be excused due to the amount of fun you get by playing it. If you don`t own this yet, be aware that you will need at least a Quad Core CPU and a beefy Graphics Card as it is very CPU/RAM/Graphic intensive. I give this 10/10.

review:
Not sure about this one. Would say i deffinitly got my moneys worth out of it in hours. Did not like the characters or the cut scenes, they quickly started to drag on. Did not enjoy the story line quests either. Only worth in this game is the claiming of the towers and outposts which is the same as farcry 3 but a new map. The grapple climbing is very well done but the forcing of long quests without weapons that you spent hours unlocking seems pointless. There are still errors with the mechanics, like opening of the wing suit and jumping over walls. Worst of all is the Shangri-la quests, on hardmode there is almost no possible plan attack its just sloppy arcade style with respawning bad guys.

I read a review saying some things similar to what i have said here before i got the game. After getting it i had a few moments where i thought this is awesome. Not most is done i am bored as with it. Dont think i would replay once i get to 100% and the only parts left are the slow collecting of bits that simply remind me of GTA collections, not very fun. 

Final note, the arena is most cool and probably best part of the game. for $75 you will get your money worth but could have had more work, or work put into better areas of the game.

This game has many similarities to far cry 3, there are a few things that seperete the two. To be blunt I believe the story line of this game is lacking and not as interesting. Far Cry 3 is a way better game in storyline. I personaly think they just made the same game twice and added a few new features with a diferent plot, but it can be forgiven, who would want to stray to far from a previosly sucsusful game. I if I were developing a sequel to a legendary game, I would make it as similar to that game as possible.

review:
The game is broken. There have been numerous times when the next part of the objective, the cutscene, tutorial, or even enemy encounters wouldn't load. I found that if I "reset default settings" in the graphics menu, it would work. However, this is tedious that we have to do this when consoles are capable of playing the game without having to reset anything. Furthermore, I was using the default settings from the start.

My PC specs are below if you care:

AMD FX-8350 4.0GHz 8-Core Processor
Gigabyte GA-990FXA-UD3 ATX AM3+ Motherboard
AMD R9 Gamer Series 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR3-2400 Memory
PNY Optima 240GB 2.5" Solid State Drive
Western Digital Red 4TB 3.5" 5900RPM Internal Hard Drive
XFX Radeon R9 290 4GB Double Dissipation Video Card
Cooler Master HAF X ATX Full Tower Case
Cooler Master V850 850W 80+ Gold Certified Fully-Modular ATX Power Supply
Asus DRW-24B1ST/BLK/B/AS DVD/CD Writer
Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 (OEM) (64-bit)
Asus VG248QE 144Hz 24.0" Monitor
TP-Link TL-WDN4800 802.11a/b/g/n PCI-Express x1 Wi-Fi Adapter

review:
Personally, I love the game although after playing for awhile some things would feel repetitive. 
Coming from someone who played Far Cry 3, Far Cry 4 would feel just like a improved version of FC3 like the Co-Op campaign and Elephant/New weapons also my favourite Buzzer which helps you to clear Radio Tower without effort. I took about 60 hours to do a 100% Completion.

Conclusion

If you love to explore and venture in the wild you would probably love this game.
But if you're more into the story, unfortunately your time spent in this game would be in a flash.

review:
boiled down to its essence this is farcry 3: in the mountains
with that said yes it is fun, sure the animals are feeling less helpful this time around (attempting to ghost a outpost and oop a eagle or dhole has decided to ruin my plan out or the near blue, seriously the eagles in this game are menaces) but you can grab a wilgsuit early on and enjoy winsuiting off the top of a condenmed temple (lets call a spaid a spaid its a radio tower) towards something that looks interesting to do or grab a buzzer and fly about wreaking havoc with a grenade launcher. ground vehiclse have a auto drive feature that can be activated when you have a marker active and are on a road so you can focus on other things that might be happening (like the royal army vehicles that are shooting at you or just enjoy the veiw)

review:
well, this game, for me, is buggier than assassin's creed unity and watchdogs combined. I had trouble with the first runs, that made it unplayable... but those  were patched. Then, I had about an hour of bug free gameplay. When suddenly, my game just decided to start running in windowed mode... This was the start of the typical ubibullshit. Suddenly, out of the blue, I can no longer run it fullscreen period. Took me a while and a good bit of being pissed off to figure that out. Now, I get random crashes... All for different reasons. Sometimes it stops responding, sometimes it stops my drivers, sometimes it just closes. I really don't know how software just breaks like that but it did. 
Some people complain about lowfps, now the game actually seemed optimized fine, I was running 2k settings in it which I almost never do in games. The shadows suck though, and the overall look of the game is nothing special. Nothing you haven't seen before.
So besides the fact that its pretty much broken... heres a couple more reasons to avoid playing this.
When you do actually get the game going, you want to troubleshoot your settings a bit. First time, you're gunna get about 15 or more minutes of intros and cutscenes... that you can't skip. So even if you save your graphics settings there, and restart the game to feel its fully applied, guess what... its all fucking reset and you have to watch the unskippables again. In fact, every cutscene is unskippable, and trust me, you're gunna want to skip some of these, because they are just stupid. 
Here's another really irritating fucking thing. So, you actually play a little, it's telling you to go to the first mission but you say no, because it's an open world and you're still kinda troubleshooting. Well, you go left instead of forward, because thats the only other way you can go really. You find a hanglider. You get on it, and die asap. You're reborn, you get back to it thinking you screwed up, get on it, and die again. You do this 3 more times and realize, no, there is nothing you can do, this hanglider hits a tree during its take off animation and it will kill you every time you use it. So there goes the first hour of your far cry 4 experience. 
So here's some pros for the game.
You finally just say fuck that fucking hanglider, you go to the mission, grab an atv, and then go ram that hanglider the fuck off the cliff. You play some of the story and start to get the hang of the mechanics and crafting and weapons. Start to care for the story and your character development. Maybe play a coop with a way better player. Then BAM. (back to a con) your game breaks. Suddenly you cant go fullscreen, suddenly you can't go 10 minutes without freezing or crashing or drivers stopped working...

So what do you do, you go and play assassin's creed unity just fucking fine, while all your friends complain about how it doesnt work at all for them and they ask you to come play farcry. 

wtf is wrong with ubisoft?

review:
The graphics are amazing. It is a very well polished and detailed game.
The only main disappointment so far is the shortness of the main story line. There are literally 30 some missions. If you purely go for the main missions, you can probably finish the game in like 5 hours.
However overall, this game is still good. 8/10

review: It's a fun one. Very similar to FC3; take out the towers to remove fog war, take over outposts to gain fast travel/waypoints/quests. You get your own place which you can spend money on to trick out and getting your own personal chopper that's always available is GREAT. I feel like there's many more animals in this one and the wildlife early on can actually be kind of scary until you get big guns on your side. I feel like the outposts in this one are easier than FC3... the AI in general to me feels easier and I don't believe I've improved that much since FC3. The bad guy in FC3 was better... honestly very few games will beat him. Have not tried multiplayer at all, but there is a co-op mode for the campaign which is a nice addition. Overall I do recommend it, but not much different than the previous in the series.

review:
Wow! I didn't play it before to try to finish up Assassins Creed Unity, but I should have dropped it before and play this game instead.

First, graphics are great. Of course, the vistas help make the better of them. I use the screenshot key real often.
Second, the shooting part is really good. Just choose how you want to play most missions and go ahead. If it dowsn't work, you simply start that part at the last checkpoint, so you don't have to replay too much.

I'm still early in the game, but what I've seen make me anxious to play again tonight when I'll get up.

review:
At the moment the game had a unrecoverable bug at the end of act two "Don't look down" mission where the all your weapons and the minimap disappears and there is nothing further that you can do in the game to fix this at that point. I am stuck there like many of the other players. Its a shame because I completed a half of the game and now I can't finish the game because of this issue.
I am not the only one facing this issue as there are large number of other gamers with the same problem but ubisoft hasn't fixed it yet. I really liked the game till this point but now I am screwed.
Google for "far cry 4 don't look down bug"

review:
Far Cry 4 is basically Far Cry 3 with a new story on top; you still capture towers and outposts. Gameplay mechanics are almost verbatim. If you liked FC3, then you should be able to enjoy FC4. I enjoyed both games but grew tired of the mechanics by the end of FC4.

As FC3 was graphically demanding, FC4 is more graphically demanding. I only started playing after the 1.6 patch and I've not experienced any bad hitching. You will need to take into consideration that you may not be able to crank up all details and get a smooth experience, so drop details until you can maintain your desired frame rate. FC4 is very pretty, though, and that's what really kept me going. I ran it with a Galaxy GTX 780 HOF with an overclock on the RAM, which helps quite a bit; FC4 loves to use everything it can. The graphics are very nice, so it's definitely not just wasting energy on the GPU.

I recommend Far Cry 4, but consider that it is very similar to Far Cry 3 and judge for yourself what that is worth to you.

review:
I would recommend this since the story is pretty good and i really liked it on a matter of being beliavable it beats far cry 3 on a matter of how you fight or kill any important story character it sucks since the only posible way to deal with everyone except with the one you left alive of the good side is always shoot/not shoot with a 1911 you dont get to knife fight them you dont get to takedown you only shoot/not shoot 1911 also the major problem is that the bad guy isn´t nice but it is the kind of interesting guy you would defenately want to take a drink with or have a cofee with so he also isnt very easy to hate at least for me and for pretty much all the peaple who bought the game if you read the reviews the second biggest problem is that the creators mentallity when making this was lets make this awesome thing but not lets make sure it works fine in every plataform this creates a lot of big bouthshit moment where you begin to ask yourself over and over again was this game worth the 60(normal version normal price) or 60.50(gold on sale) or 49(normal on sale) or 89 dolars(gold not on sale(not recommended))  i paid for it? For example just to give you a picture of the situacion you might encounter i personally had trouble gliding at first but you get used to it now the problem is a phenomenum i would call gliding /running when you are running an you jump of a ledge you might just want to grapple something or fall to the ground again but no since you were running with shift a lot of times since you use shift to open parachute you will sudenlly open it and crash into a wall depleting all or almost all you health wich leads me to another problem why the fuck did no one in the whole uplay team thought " hu ,maybe we could let the player customize the parachute opcion or change it for control since you dont usually crouch in the middle of air" no because uplay does not have that style another example is why the fuk do takedowns almost seem imposible? And this is because since the new far cry enemies seem to be perfect gun-butt attakers like they do this like ninjas especially the heavy he wields it like if he wielded his penus so naturally then another problem one of the few that far cry 3 also haves why do our faction does not have a single especial except snipers like they are ak-47 wielders or snipers wielding a dragunov not anything else not even a shotgun guy also the factio that has this new unit i call arrow-magician who basically hypnotizes animals against you and uses arrow fire and normal is the faction belongin to the "bad guy"who explicitly hates traditional stuff and said anyone doing anything religius is subject to dye so if he hates traditions so much why he uses arrow ancient language speaking atakers this seems very traditional to me dont get me wrong i love the pagan character as a buddy but not as an enemy he should be the guy who helpes you kill the ones you are fighting with  but not the bad guy is more we discover he was actually kind of good at the end so explain me why make a game orientated just so you know you fighted all the time just for the wrong side? i could see this from a shitty anime game or something like that but not from a major franchise.  Lets keep adressing issues except for the new dlc where you get to play a big mission in co op all the other is small shitty missions in co´-op also let me tell you something idiots my friend now has dlc gun i dropped on the floor in order for him to grab it and he didnt pay for it so why allow the friends of players to grab their friends exclusive guns one could see this as good but it isnt since it is another reason why the price tag of the seson pass is not worth it since there is 2 mission dlc and the new durgush or something prison dlc wich is not working properly on steam i have rage quitted this game many times know but this time i decided to do justice another thing that hasnt affected me a whole lot but is pretty annoying and a fact that makes this worse than far cry 3 is the fact you only get 1 save slot and you while on a mission have an out of bounds area too small so you might experience things like going out of bound you will lose all your progrees example you are in a mission to collect pakeges so you go you kill guys you loot them you see a ton of loot crates you loot them you collect the first the pakege you save you go for the second you get killed and then you lost all the money from the bodyes and the crates you are reespawned back into the crate place so you lost the soldiers money and time looting the crates so wtf why did i save it manually if it wont even car eabout that?
Finally i do recommend this since it is an far cry 3 retake(cant believe i say this after complaining of the fact that people think this) wich has some improves but in some aspect it is just damn worse. Would play again the campain currently doing it but will do it slowly since i will frequently rage quit also i have season pass still waiting durguesh prison.

review:
This is an ultimate sandbox game experience, but with a clear objective. The clarity is defined by YOU, the gamer, as you gain insight in whats going on in this ancient region. Your insights will guide you in the path you are about to take; A path that only can be walked, not told. Be aware! Your path is affected by an ongoing conflict and there is more than one thing that will try to end you, either by default or because of your doing. 

This game is a rewarding experience, and the difficulty is kept on an ever increasing level to keep you on your toes. But you also gain rewards and cash to buy better things to carry with you to survive. To beat the game, you have to play for a long time. However, if you stick to the storyline, the campain can be finished in an tolerable time. 

I give this game my best recommendations if you enjoy advanced tactics and strategic game planning.

You have to sign up for a separate account on a third party website to play. I loved the main story. Was a fun play through. Kinda repetitive though. All the villages look the same, really. I could never tell them apart. Nothing to exciting about the side quests. You can do like 6 hunting missions where you have to use a selected weapon. Usually a bow. Racing missions, Convoy missions. Take down radio towers. It was alright but not worth what I paid. If this game was on sale for $20 I'd say give it a try.

review: After playing Far Cry 4 for 15 hours, i would say that Far Cry 3 is a better game.  Play that one instead if you havn't already.  Far Cry 4 does have slightly better graphics and the animals are REALLY well done (although some feel out of place rhinos and elephants), but the environment is just not that interesting...its hard to explain but the 'landscaping' is just not as clever as Far Cry 3.   Gameplay is fine and the few little additions like rock climbing, personal helicopter and riding elephants are really nice.  IN some ways Far CRy 4 has become more like Just Cause 2 with its squirrel suit and parachute and driving missions but instead of making the side quests fun they have become just filler with no real excitement or pay off.  Just Cause 2 is an amazing game!! super fun!!  Go play that instead...   i wouldn't say Far Cry 4 is a waste of time because you can enjoy it but there are better games out there.... I wish the series would get back to Far Cry 2 style with a few Fallout 3 esque elements!!!!!  i hope they go to the desert next!!

review:
This is one of the best games I played in a long time. It has a well written story that makes you feel like your there. The amount of content that this has is ridiculous. ( In a good way) Much more than Far Cry 3. The game is extremely well optimized. Runs as good as Far cry 3 if not better. Much more guns than FC3 as well, all unique. 

-The Co-op- 

The Co-op includes everything you would image a co-op to have. Separate side missions. Almost flawless compatibility and everything the singleplayer has except the singleplayer campaign. How the co-op works is, you go into the menu and press invite freinds. The uplay overlay will open, and you invite the friend you want. Extremely easy. Whoever is host will have the same progress as they did in the campaign. So the content he/she unlocked in the singleplayer will be transferred over to the co-op, which is a feature I like alot.

-Battles of Kyrat-

This game mode is a 5v5 versus match, with a variety of game modes. You can pick from different maps, and upgrade your charter with the ingame points you get for scoring or getting kills.

-Community Maps-

Commuity maps are the maps other people make with the Far Cry 4 editor. Some can be good, and some not so much. But I had fun with them never the less. Pretty strait forward.

-Map Editor-

The map editor is basically a simpler version of a full game engine. You can't make your own models, or textures (as far as I know) but it still isn't to restricted. You can still make some incredible maps. You have almost all the assets from the full game to use. You can change the water level, add npcs, change the skybox, and the ambient sounds, grass, trees etc.

-Opinions-

So far this game has been amazing. The only really downside is some bugs here and there, but then again it didn't come out to long ago. It's a great game, and I highly recommend it.

review:
A fun romp through a great open world play ground. This treads the line between the greatness of far cry 2 in terms of an interesting world that feels alive (although still missing the buddy system that made that game great) and some of the great gameplay elements of Far Cry 3. The main character is a little bit of a cipher in that he is just a means to an ends for experiencing the story but overall I far preferred this to 3. There is still something about Far Cry 2 that just means it will forever have a place in my heart but this game is definately a good game in it's own right.

8.5/10

review:
Kyrat Grilled Cheese

2 tbsp garden vegetable cream cheese, at room temperature
3 scallions, sliced 
1 tablespoon butter, plus more as needed 
2 slices sourdough bread  
2 ounces mozzarella, thinly shaved or sliced 
Everything Bagel Seasoning (recipe follows)

Everything Bagel Seasoning:
1 teaspoon sesame seeds
3/4 teaspoon poppy seeds 
1/2 teaspoon dried minced garlic 
1/2 teaspoon dried minced onion 
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt 

Heat pan. Butter both sides of the bread. Cook one side of the bread slices golden brown. Then add cream cheese, scallion, everything bagel seasoning, and mozzarella to cooked side. Close sandwich. Cook outside. Serve.

review:
Meh is about all I can say.

Sure, it's a decently fun game, you run around and shoot stuff like 100s of other FPS games; but that's about it.

First and foremost, it took 2 months and several patches before I could even play the game, so that was a huge let down and let me know out the gate that the game wasn't ready for launch, but of course they launched it anyway.

Co-op is still bugged to hell, invivisble vehicles and enemies anyone?

The story is pretty bland and leaves everything to be desired. 
The main "bad guy" is a white rip off of Vaas from Far Cry 3. 
The conbat feels like it came right out of the early 2000's, basic and uninspiring to say the least. I mean, in a game based soley around combat, you can't even pistol whip someone.
The driving controls are archaic and terrible.
The option to not be forced to join the "golden path" would have been nice, but it is what it is.
The entire map is quite small when compared to other franchise titles. The only thing that makes it seem like the world is large is the fact there are so many mountains that you have to contantly go around (when not fast travelling of course).

I could go on and on and on, but there's no point really. Ubisoft clearly rushed this game in order to cash in on xmas and end of year sales; and clearly doesn't give a rats *** about producing a quality title.

The only reason I still play it is because a buddy of mine and I play together on co-op and are trying to get the most out of our money by running around doing nonsense like running through invisible cars/people and racing on quads/dune buggys. So if you're looking for a game that you can utterly waste time in but have no real expectations of a premium game sold at a premium price, then this title might be right for you. Otherwise, spend your money on something else and have more fun than just "wasting time".

At least the world is somewhat pretty I guess.

But I for one won't bother spending any more money on Ubisoft titles in the future.

review: This is a really great game in a lot of respects.  It has wonderful graphics, a huge world to explore and so many methods of travel.   It has a lot going for it.  However, there are some things that nearly ruin the entire game.  It has such a  lousy, crappy and unfair  "save game" aspect that it makes me want to puke.  And some of the missions are ridiculous in that it's simply "figure out how many steps to take in this direction... then DIE" and then reload and repeat and repeat and repeat until you have memorized the EXACT sequence of events...."so many steps in this direction, then hide, then move in another direction and wait so many seconds, then etc etc etc etc".   There is NO skill involved in this type mission.... just an exercise in memorizing.  Oh well.  I will recommend this game, but be prepared to cuss a lot.  And by the way, I am talking strictly from a PC gamer perspective.   No stinking consoles of any type for me.

review:
Ok so... honestly Far cry 4 was a really fun game, there are only three reasons I cannot bring myself to reccomend the game. 

One the storyline: yes it was interesting but it seems forced at times, and the choices you made wether it be to preserve or destroy have no effect what so ever (as far as I can tell) after you finish the main story except a few lines, even the major choices like kill (no spoilers), or spare (no spoilers) doesn't matter at all! 

Two (oh am I gonna get hate for this) the villains: yes Pagan is a great enemy who you can learn to love/hate but he, and his entire group get next to no explination. In fact the one villian I actually thought about after the fact was Paul and thats because I parked and listened to his whole story, the rest of them have very little told about them other than basic things told right before, during, or after their fight. Even Pagan himself gets little explination untill the very end other than, yeah he's a crazy dictator who knew your mom, can you kill him for us?
  
Three pointless side missions: You would think liberating the entire south would lower the amount of enemies right? well not by much (if at all). Also a person would be lead to believe there was something to force them to liberate outposts right? The answer is a big nope, I left the entire north and there was no penalty at all except unlocking a weapon I would never buy. The last bit I can add to the pointlessness is this, after you find a chopper you will never have to touch the ground or non-required enemies again.

While I may not like aspects of the game its still REALLY fun and some of the characters can really make your day (Yogi & Regi), and to be honest I liked the written story in the game and if they had incorperated what the written lore has then I would definitly reccomend this game. Also the satisfying ending is lovely (no spoilers, but bring the worst pistol if you want to laugh).

The final thought I have about this game is this: I like it enough that I feel I got my moneys worth, but play this for the guns, drug trips, whats written,and the psyco, not the story, or 100%ing (<-this one will make you hate the game).

The last bit I can add to the pointlessness is this, after you find a chopper you will never have to touch the ground or non-required enemies again.

While I may not like aspects of the game its still REALLY fun and some of the characters can really make your day (Yogi & Regi), and to be honest I liked the written story in the game and if they had incorperated what the written lore has then I would definitly reccomend this game. Also the satisfying ending is lovely (no spoilers, but bring the worst pistol if you want to laugh).

The final thought I have about this game is this: I like it enough that I feel I got my moneys worth, but play this for the guns, drug trips, whats written,and the psyco, not the story, or 100%ing (<-this one will make you hate the game).", "timestamp_created": 1421219143, "timestamp_updated": 1421219143, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": 0.5, "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
A very familiar formula to Far Cry 3, with the addition of dynamic elements incorperated into the game through unique vehicles, opponents, wildlife and NPC interactions. Through intriquet scripting and voicing, the charatcers you interact with throughout the game generally have an interesting field of depth, as they may reveal portions of their past and how their story came to be. 

With that being said, the highlighted antagonist, Pagan Min, demonstrates qualities that draw your attention like none other. Unlike the average villain that vows to elimate all who oppose's them, Pagan has an unsettling relaxed-attitude that makes the player wonder of the extensive past of this individual, grasping your attention. Like Vaas, you feel the desire to learn more of this fanatic. Pagan and Vaas are also two very opposing characters in their own unique way, as they excell in certain areas of development, with their own seperate strengths and weaknesses. Far Cry's antagonist reputation-bar has been raised once again.

In correspondence to Far Cry 3's protagonist, Jason Brody, the ravine-gap of development that would be expected going from zero-to-terminator  was once again crossed with the easy breeze of a parachute. All possible development stages for the protagonist were once again stripped, as you dawdle out of a building and endeavour upon your massacre, keeping in mind you've never had a glimpse of knowledge towards the combat field. This mistake was also apparent in Far Cry 3, although atleast Jason stopped himself after his first kill, and reflected upon his actions, then proceeded to clear two islands.

Tl;Dr - If you loved Far Cry 3, you'll love this even more. Hail Kyra.

review:
You'd think being mostly copy paste from FC3 that it wouldn't be super buggy. Wrong.
You'd also think that with all the advertising stuff about co-op, that it would stay functional for more than 5 minutes.. WRONG!
Check my screenshots for FC4 co-op bugs out the wazoo. I didn't even try to break the game, I just played normally.
Keep in mind those are only the ones I took pics of, there were at least 50 more things that went wrong (not exaggerating).


Overall it's fun and you should get it, but not at full price and not in it's current state. Also don't expect co-op to work well.

review:
Far Cry 4 is effectively the step up from Far Cry 3 and in many, many ways. In Farc Cry 3 there were times where the open world gameplay felt blank or empty. Whilst in this game... Suddenly everything can go wrong in an instant. But at the same time. Everything can also go right.

The world is massive. Hundreds of places to explore and even more events that occur along the way. The co-op play can use some work but beyond that the game and the multiplayer is actually thouroughly enjoyable. 

I recommend this game to anyone who wants a more versatile feel to FPS games. Stealth is an option, Guns is an option. Even wild animals and ELEPHANTS are an option. What is there not to love?

Just wanted to say having had this game from day 1. I have not really had the time to play it much, but i dont have 1 problem with it. It sucks that so many people have issues launching or getting it to run smooth. Since day 1 i start it up change all my setting to ultra, and that was it, it has run fine the whole time. I now see there have been some patches which is good news, and think i need to finally finish my adventure. 
Overall i will give this game a 9\10 for the moment, 1 short of ten because of cutscenes, i hate them. if i dont want to watch them after the first time, then let me skip it. 
:)

review:
5.0 out of 10.
Story/Plot are absolutely horrible. Honestly, every NPC in this game may as well be a cardboard cutout that just waves and spits out missions. I'm convinced they fired the story writer  3 days after they started production, but the design team never got the memo to stop making NPCs... so there they are, bland and boring, with no real story to speak of.

gameplay is pretty much the same as farcry 3, but now you get bait to lure predator animals AND you can rain grenades on your enemies from a helecopter... for shooty stabby, i recomend, for plot i don't.
A ton of fun in a beautiful world.

review: If your a fan of FC3 you will LOVE this game. Everything you love about FC3 just streamlined, optimized, and tweaked to bring out the best gameplay. If your afraid of the critics saying oh its just a FC3 reskin well they are wrong there are tons of new features, modes, and gameplay to make you fall in love with this game. Honestly though FC3 was about as perfect a game could get, and while its hard to improve on perfection, they managed to do it here in FC4. 10/10.

review: This is a fantastic game and like far cry 3, it has a fantastic story. Along your journey, you will have to make very important decisions which could steer your gameplay in a whole other direction. They also make the enemies heartless douchebags so you feel like your actualy killing for a cause. The graphics are also fantastic, it almost looks as if you are in real life. overall, this is an amazing game and i highly recomend.

review: What an amazing game... I cannot explain how incredibly awesome the experience was. Not only is the campaign compelling and addictive, but so are all the crazy side quests. My favorite part was driving around in some random Royal Guard truck and running into all sorts of random battles between The Golden path (resistance) and the Royal Army (Pagan's  peeps). I don't think I have enjoyed a game as much as I have enjoyed this one in a long time, and it was undoubtedly worth the money.

review:
I want to like this game. Indeed, it's open-world in nature, plenty to see and to do, lots of fun things... but rife with bugs even quite a while after the launch. I have constant graphical issues (latest stable nVidia drivers, no issues in other games,) issues with saves randomly deleting ammo on load (in addition to ammo deletion when returning from Shangri-La,) odd control and keyboard issues, and more. I can't recommend this game in this state on PC. It was not a finished product and, maybe sometime in the future, it will be and I can play without frustration that I face now.  However, I'm not hopeful at this point. It's a shame I paid for a finished, playable product and got something maybe 75% of the way there. I type this having exited the game to restart due to textures randomly failing and being completely unable to see in the game.

Release a full game or don't at all. If you won't devote time to get it right on PC, don't bother. This was my first Far Cry title and it will also be my last. I'm sad to see Ubisoft go this direction as someone who has purchased many of their PC games over the years.

review:
This remarkable game has been extensively reviewed elsewhere. The purpose of THIS review is to give me an opportunity to organize my own thoughts about it. I have played all Far Cry games on PC (Far Cry and Far Cry 2, multiple times. And don’t forget the awesome Far Cry: Blood Dragon). Far Cry 4 is very similar in concept to Far Cry 3 – both very large open world games in which the protagonist, (unskilled, inexperienced, unequipped) struggles against the brutal tyranny of a charming psychopath. Although I enjoyed Far Cry 3 from beginning to end, Far Cry 4 got off to a very rocky start for me. But first the good stuff.

The implementation of stealth is very well done in this game. I say this after just finishing Crysis 3 in which there was no stealth. In Crysis 3, if you weren’t cloaked while crouched and peeking around a corner, you would be instantly fired upon by soldiers or aliens a half mile away. Ridiculous! Not so in Far Cry 4. And you really need to be stealthy in Far Cry 4. The good news is that stealthy behavior pays off a lot. Don’t need no freaking nano suit.

Elephants. One of the most fun elements of the game, riding elephants. You have to pay for this as a skill. So, work up to it. Elephants are a very safe and practical way to move across the map. Encounter an enemy patrol, no problem. Run the elephant into them and melee with the elephant’s trunk. You can destroy oncoming enemy vehicles head on. Loads of fun. Elephants also provide great protection against the multitudes of predators that menace the landscape. And even while dismounted, nearby elephants act on your behalf with close encounters involving harassments by enemies.

Shangri-La missions. Although the main story is fine, I especially enjoyed the five missions to Shangri-La. I hadn’t read about the game beforehand and I was very surprised by these missions. I especially appreciated the expose’ and enactment of the battle to wrest control over Shangri-La from the forces of evil. I was joined by a svelte ally for most of the missions. Arena style battles here and very, very challenging. Yet beautiful and enchanting.

Ghale Homstead. Reminded me of the Hearthfire DLC in Skyrim. You need to find this location, and it takes some doing to get there. Once established, you can pay for upgrades. One of the best upgrades is the option to purchase a buzzer – little gyrocopter. Buzzers are awesome ways to travel and scout out unexplored territory, but they are hard to find as just random drops. But once you own one, just fast travel to the Ghale homestead and climb in.

DJ Rabi Ray Rana. I really enjoyed the mindless chatter coming out of the radios. I know some players hated this guy, but I loved him. He injected some interesting and positive energy in what was otherwise a dreary and hopeless existence. Most of all, I loved the music that accompanied his show. I am still looking for a playlist of his music.

Weapons. As always, there are amazing weapons choices, but (as always) you have to build up to them. My favorite sidearm was the Auto-Cross. This is an automatic mini-crossbow. It is a silent one-shot killer and it is indispensable in the times before acquiring a silenced sniper rifle. I loved this thing and I never stopped carrying it. Still carried my bow, but for long-distance silent kills, the Auto-Cross excelled.

Grappling hook. It was awesome. Easy to use (after some practice). Never glitched.

Lore. The game takes place in Kyrat, a fictional country nestled between India and the Himalayan Mountains. The game’s setting is filled with ancient lore and beautiful traditional art from the region – paintings, statues of hindu deities, and shrines. The value and importance of the region’s beliefs and heritage becomes a critical consideration later in the game. I chose to preserve it.

Ethnic origins. It was pretty obvious that the Adherents and soldiers of the Golden Path were of Indian (or thereabouts) descent and the Royal Army was of Chinese origin. Accents and even expressions in native tongues revealed this difference. Somewhat mirroring the ongoing struggle in Nepal between natives of Tibet and Chinese from the north.

Noore’s Arena. Meh. Hunger Games style battles with supporters tossing in resources for you. The public address commentary is sensational and perfectly captures the depraved sentiment of the event. But after a few rounds, the arena becomes a grind to unlock weapons. You make a little money but not much. In order to unlock the much coveted Bushman silenced assault rifle, you need to achieve level 10 in the arena. I chose not to. It would be hours of formulaic running, gunning and healing. Not for me.

Now, some of the problems I had with the game. Let’s start with the main quest. In a word, fragmented. On reflection after finishing the game, the main quest seemed uncohesive, not pulled together. It kinda just went… “wherever.” For example, it seemed that after completing a main quest challenge, then afterwards for a time, there was nothing. No more challenges, no place to go. I suppose this “down time” might have been intended to give me a chance to explore the vast map, but I just felt a little too much set adrift. Then suddenly a new main quest challenge would pop up on the map. I eventually got used to this and it was fine. But overall, the story and action did not naturally cohere. It’s like reading a book and finishing a chapter. Then turn the page and there’s nothing but a blank page and several more after that. Then after a few more blank pages, you discover the next chapter.

Here is an example. As you might expect, there was the obligatory betrayal and imprisonment episode. Not surprising. But after the escape (which was a big ordeal and a really hard challenge), there was nothing. No response or comment by the antagonist. No, “I’ll get you for escaping my prison!” One day I was in his prison. The next I was out. And life just went on as if it had never happened. Lame.

Flying and falling glitches. One of the iconic activities of Far Cry games are the hang gliders. But I was conditioned to stop using them in Far Cry 4. Often I would just die immediately after deployment. I mean instantly. No collision, just falling and death. Wingsuit too. Jump off a cliff and hit the control to deploy the wingsuit (Shift key in my case) and nothing. No wingsuit just falling and death. The only device that worked reliably was the parachute. They really screwed up this joyful mechanic in this game.

Dogs. In some regions, the landscape is “hounded” by packs and packs of wild dogs. To the extent that it becomes boorish. Each pack has four or five and each dog takes nearly a full clip from an assault rifle to kill. There is just no way to walk terrain in these areas. Always need a jeep or an elephant. Which sucked because I prefer to walk most of the time. Thankfully, most regions don’t have dogs but they were present in enough places to give me a sad. In the S.T.A.L.K.E.R, games there were dogs too, but one headshot would kill them, and THEY were mutated super dogs. So, the implementation of wild dogs in Far Cry 4 was dumb.

Overall and despite some minor complaints, Far Cry 4 matched and in some cases exceeded its predecessors. The landscape is the most beautiful I can remember playing on. The bot AI was masterful. The choices I have as a player are enormous. Stealth, grappling hook, Auto Cross, elephants, buzzer, Shangri-La and I almost forgot, Yogi and Reggie help make this game very worthwhile.

review:
This is one of the best first person shooter / exploration games I have played in a very long time.  I really enjoy the characters, the wonderful graphics and environments, and the story line of the game so far. (I've played about 24 hours and I think I'm about halfway through the main story line.)

Game play has been very smooth and is very unique.  The story line up to this point has remained fun and fresh to me and I'm really enjoying it.  I don't enjoy a lot of single player titles as they don't hold my attention for very long but this one has done a great job.  That being said I am let down that the game doesn't offer full Co-op game play for the main story line.  Co-op IS still enjoyable even though you don't get to complete a lot while in multiplayer.  I would highly recommend this game for anyone who enjoys a good FPS with some exploration thrown in.
