I'll start off with the negatives, incase any of these are a deal breaker for you:
[list]
[*]The graphics are pretty demanding, so unless you have an amazing rig, I'd advise expecting to run it on the lower options.  I am using AMD everything, basically, and I've found that most of the issues AMD users were reporting early on have already been fixed (either by Ubisoft or AMD). 
[*]There are some parts where waves upon waves of enemies will be spammed at you - more than in the weed burning mission in FC3. This is really a matter of opinion, though, and can be pretty fun at times.
[/list]

The positives:
[list]
[*]My computer is quite a bit below the minimum specs recommended, and the game still works quite well most of the time. Granted, I had to update my video driver (as you do), and change a few settings in the GamerProfile.xml that weren't accessible ingame, but it worked in the end.
[*]Assuming you do have a decent computer, the graphics are seriously nice.
[*]A fairly detailed & colossal map.
[*]All of the old guns from FC3 are still here, if you had any favourites. Most people seem to be treating this as negative, but I have absolutely no problem with it, given that:
[*]Heaps of cool new weapons aswell. Most notably: an automatic crossbow, the M79 GL (which is treated as a sidearm), throwing knives (extremely accurate, silent, ranged weapons which you throw using the grenade key), and sticky variants of your favourite bombs - your grenades, mines, and C4 can now stick to whatever you throw them at - best of all, this option is toggleable on the go. There's also bait, which is thrown like a grenade to lure nearby hostile animals, which there are always a few of.
[*]Some weapons are now considered "sidearms". All this means is that they can be used in certain situations where others couldn't be - most notably, when driving any vehicle. The downside is that one of your weapon slots can only hold sidearms - however, the other 3 can also hold sidearms, if you want to have multiple. 
[*]A fair few new animals - from the small honey badgers, which are terrifyingly vicious, to the much larger rhinos & elephants.
[*] You can ride the elephants! They may seem like a gimmick, but they are a huge amount of fun. I haven't seen any outside of quests, and maybe an outpost, though. I wouldn't recommend using a RPG while you're on it though, they uh, don't survive the blast too well. Or at all really.
[*]Ever wanted to race a tuk tuk? Probably not, but now you can anyway!
[*]Gyrocopters - by far the most convenient mode of transport, only losing in style to any elephant.
[*]A grappling hook, which can only be used in specific spots. It adds a nice bit of variance to climbing puzzles, and provides a good number of alternate routes to various places.
[*]Adopts the alternate approach system from Far Cry 2 for some of the main quests, meaning that you get to choose from two different ways to deal with the mission. If you care for immersion, it can make for some pretty interesting choices.
[*]Far more random encounters, with greater variance. It can be quite fun to save a couple of hostages while moving towards your goal, or to stop a honey badger terrorizing an innocent civilian (and get paid for it).
[*]Huge amount of notes, books, and other information lying around in game which enriches the story setting nicely. If you like reading about game lore, then you'll probably be happy with this.
[*]Greater variance in voice acted lines, and a great amount of contextual lines - for example: I've heard people saying things specific to the outpost they were in after I'd liberated it.
[*]Improved AI - I had no complaints with the AI in FC3, but it's definitely better here.
[*][spoiler]Wish you could've sided with Hoyt in FC3 (who doesn't)? Well, there's a secret ending that lets you peacefully end the game by siding with Pagan Min. Pretty snazzy detail, I think.[/spoiler]
[*]The sidequests are plentiful, and much improved. If you were planning on skipping over them and just following the main questline, I'd really advise giving them a try.
[*]The HUD is fairly customizable, to a point which should make fans of ziggy's mod happy.
[*]New weapon/crafting wheel system, which can be extremely handy, especially since it can toggle sticky bombs, and craft + use syringes on the go, although it can take a little getting used to.
[/list]

Skills and equipment have been rebalanced, with some things that were skill dependant in FC3 now being available by default, or obtained through other methods. For example: instead of having a skill to get 2 skins from a single animal, you just have to make it a 'clean kill' instead - using bolts, arrows, or your kukri instead of bullets/fire/explosions. The wingsuit is now available from the start, I believe. It can be obtained in the shop for about 25 grand, by picking it up for free in a couple places, or somehow not obtaining it long enough for it to be given to you during a mission.

The story, while seen from the point of view of the main character, is far less centered on him than it was on Jason Brody in Far Cry 3. While I'm a little sad about this, it also pays off hugely because it enables the story to focus more on the struggles of the country, from the over all civil war, the condition of the Golden Path group, to minor details like a son's father being killed for trying to set up a free radio station. This results in a fairly rich environment, and I found that it added a whole lot more depth to the game world.

I've missed a whole lot of great points, but it's an extremely fun game, and I'd happily recommend it to anyone.

Edit: I've finished the main story, but definitely not all of the game, so I'll finish off my review by adding that by the end, I loved the story. It has high replayability - both the gameplay and the story, since you can choose alternate paths which affect both.", "timestamp_created": 1416514768, "timestamp_updated": 1434166007, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 75, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.749343454837799072", "comment_count": 4, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
NOTE: I LIKE THE GAME, BUT HAVE BUYERS REMORSE FOR SPENDING $90 ON IT!

PROS:
GRAPHICS- They're beautiful , so so smooth. This is the first "pretty" game I've put my new rig though (i7-4790K, GTX 780Ti, 16GB RAM). Hardly any glitches***, which is weird from a Ubisoft game.

NEW MECHANICS- I love being able to shoot out of vehicles, using elaphants as living tanks, and the tiny chopper helps with getting around the map.

HUGE MAP- So much to explore, see, and do, I'm still scratching the surface.

COMBAT- As much fun as Far Cry 3, which is good because that didn't need to be fixed. No greater feeling than jumping on top of a heavy and ruthlessly stabbing him through his big stupid chest.

WILDLIFE- More interactive and adds to the emergent gameplay. A rhino unexpectedly helped me take out a convoy, but then promply turned on me. I was forced to kill him with a Grenade Launcher which is all kinds of wrong.

WEAPONS- An armory full of fun. They even brought back a lot of the signature weapons from 3 and added plenty more. #Bushman4Lyfe

CONS: 
STORY- Not as good as 3's in my opinion. Choosing which Golden Path mission you're going to take sucks because no matter what you choose, something goes wrong and then the other leader gets all butt hurt at you for not listening to them. Also, there is no explanation as to how Ajay became such a badass all of a sudden. In 3 there is a buildup of badassness and a few skills that are easily explained by the exposition. But in 4 you drop into Kyrat and can shoot, fly, climb, hunt, craft, and of course mercilessly kill people pretty much from the get go.

PRICE TAG- As I mentioned at the top, I regret paying $90 for the Gold version and season pass. If some good DLC's come around I'll change my mind. But it's no great enlightenment that video game companies are making a killing off suckers like me who preorder these games at full price or more and find it wasn't quite worth it.

***I've heard of the mouse deceleration and black screen issues, but have yet to experience any myself. It could be that I'm running a high end rig that can handle the "next-genness" of this game, but I can't be sure. 

All I'm saying is that if I don't get to stab a Yeti in the face at some point I'm gonna be pissed.

TL;DR 7/10 right now, 8/10 or 9/10 depending on DLC content.

review:
Summary: Great open-world exploration game, 8.5/10
Pros: Beautiful graphics, huge game world, exotic wildlife
Cons: Not enough interactivity with the environment

I personally love open-world games, and I have to put FC4 right up there among my all-time favorites in the genre.  The incredible attention to detail never ceases to impress me, especially considering the game world's immense size.  It's the unexpected, gratuitous little details that get me, like when a crocodile suddenly lunges to grab a deer walking along the riverbank and drags it under.  They didn't have to put that behavior in there: it has no effect on gameplay, and it's rare enough that you might play for weeks and never see it happen.  But IMO that's the kind of detail that makes games like this worth the big bucks you pay for them.

Combat, story, mission variety, and player progression are pretty standard for games of this type, but there is one feature that really sets FC4 apart: its wildlife.  There aren't any dragons or orcs or demons in this game, yet it still has a more varied and interesting fauna than any game I've ever played.  Despite their lack of magical abilities, every animal has a unique behavior -- they're not simply "predators" or "prey".  The flighty, deer-like sambar travel in groups of 3 or 4 and avoid everything else that moves; a pack of wolves will approach a tiger but run away when challenged; an elephant will wade into a river and spray water on its back.  And so on.  More so than any other game I've seen, the animals breathe real life into the game world.

The main complaint I have is that, for all its teeming variety, there isn't much interaction you can perform with the game world.  There are hundreds of chests scattered all over, but they only ever contain money, ammo, or generic items that can be sold for money.  There are grappling points on cliffs that can be used to scale them.  And there are a few destructable items like barrels here and there, but there's rarely ever any point (or satisfaction) in destroying them.  And that's about it!  There aren't any switches or levers to open gates or move crane arms or whatnot, or for that matter any items that you can manipulate in any way.  Although every location is unique and exquisitely detailed, the game world is more or less static.  It was actually with a sense of relief that I finally confronted the evil tyrant and beat the game, because it was beginning to border on tedious, even for an obsessive completionist like myself.

review:
Far Cry 4 looks amazing. I am quite surprised that I can run it wonderfully on ultra. One thing that bothered me until I figured it out was the slight mircostudder that occurs. There is a simple fix that I found online. In GamerProfile.xml within 'My Documents' > FarCry4, change the following from 0 to 1: DisableLoadingMip0 = "0" and GpuMaxBufferedFrames = "0". After that it ran without any "studdering". I hghly reccomend this. Such beautiful landscape. Another thing I ran into was that there is no difference in FOV from the lowest setting and the highest setting. It might just be me, but hopefully it will become fixed.

Other than those two small noticable bugs, I am having a great expirience with this new game. You would enjoy it as much as I am.

review:
Watched two bears battle each other, then shot the winner with a harpoon gun. 

Set an elephant on fire and watched it ramage through an outpost.

Set a rhino on fire, watched it ramage through an outpost, then shot it with a harpoon gun. 

PETA would have nightmares playing this game.

10/10

review:
It's Great Adventure. 
Love it so far. Beautiful, realistic environment, challenging combat at times.
the gameplay is AWESOME and crazy, and hardly ever gets boring.
forget the royal atmy, their a side quest, the eagles are the real enemy

Positive:
-Great Graphics
-Awesome Story
-Open World

Negatives:
-Uplay Servers ( but hey its launch lol )
-Multiplayer Co-op & PVP 

 expected it to be extremely similar to FC3. 

Characters are interesting, Uplay still sucks, and i am having fun playing this game.

9/10 It hurts to say this, because I love this franchise. Once again, UBI fails at multiplayer.

review: its got a taste of all the other far crys plus more, personally im really having fun ubi made a good game here there are tons of things to do and the patch made everything smooth as silk on ultra 1920x1080 and the main psycho is great this is gonna be a long game but fun as hell. If you like getting missions done your way. the wildlife is way more dangerus then in farcry 3 its more fun to hunt now plus you youself become the prey for some of these animals ... the eagle, snakes, damn badgers, all those wild beasts. When i first started the game i was walking through the forest to cut through to a next mission and suddenlly a snake jumped out of the grass and bit me then an eagle came down and attacked me point is i was complelty not expecting that crap haha. anyway i recommend this game to all those who like fps's and a huge playground to destroy things plus great acting. and you can replay outposts! :)... its awesome imo. get it.

review:
Finally a game that gets it!!

Lets start off by saying this is just fun. Not to mention Graphically Amazing vast and open world.
Everything in the game appears to be Achievable and not like your Grinding sick hard just to get a weapon so your not pwned. Money is pretty easy to get but not too easy. Upgrades can be obtained by hunting and that is a ton of fun cause you will run into tons of unplanned world events while going around and hunting animals to craft your upgrades. I Also Purchased AC Unity and let me tell you that was the biggest disappointment ever! (Writing bad review for that game after) Anyways all they do in AC Is try to get you to spend more money even if you purchased gold edition and the game is full of gamebreaking bugs and support never replys. awful! just awful! Anyways if you want a game that actually works and is fun to play for hours this is it!

This game is really good, if you like far cry 3, you will love this game, it's almost the same. With some new tools.
BUY IT! 

8/10 

Future Patch maybe? Taking away the small glitches...

review:
First review.... well there will not be one because Uplay is a huge pile of shit and wont work. They really need to fix these issues for a game that costs this amount of money. We should be able to play the game full game when its released not have to come write rage reviews because you released and sold a  unfinished product.

Finally after hours of countless time wasted was able to get into the game. It's very beautiful and game play is smooth, but mouse movement seems sloppy. The bow is very fun to use and so are the throwing knives. Having animals come out of the blue when a piece of meat is thrown kinda ruins immersion. An interesting game so far, will continue to check it out.

review:
Simply amazing. It holds up to the previous games and at the very least, if not surpassing the previous title, matches it in every single way. With a new unique setting in the himalayas (how many games do that?!) and with a literally colorful and entertaining antagonist, plus the introduction of sandbox co-op to the series, makes this a solid if not must play title. Oh and did I mention you get to ride elephants and flip over trucks with them while shooting a rocket launcher from their back? Yah.

Solid 9/10 Overall
Singleplayer experience is a 10/10 Imo.

Would be 10/10 overall but well, uplay sucks balls (eternally) and co-op seems to be sandbox/side mission only and not available for the storyline missions. As well as some, often comical, co-op bugs (nothing too gamebreaking just things sometimes don't sync so your friend sees a truck in the road but you don't and on his screen you plowed straight through it lol).

review:
11/27/14 Edit:
This game is not without its problems, but overall, I would highly recommend it. If you are looking for huge improvements over Far Cry 3, you will probably be disappointed. The gameplay is virtually identical with its frat-boy protagonist, outposts, hunting and crafting, and missions that seem like a chore that takes you away from the real fun of the game. The real reason to purchase this game is for the co-op. Drop-in/drop-out (with a reload) co-op allowing full access to the map in its entirety with all missions and events fully accessible takes this game from an ok sequel to an awesome evolution of an already great game. It adds a level of polish that makes it everything Far Cry 3 should have been.

Now, the things that annoy me. For one, they still have not fixed the "black screen" crash issue. I know it has been fixed for some but it hasn't for me, despite Ubisoft's patch and insulting comments about making sure I meet the minimum requriements. I can get the game to run but only after several launch and crash attempts do I actually get to the main menu. 

Also, eagles. Ubisoft, why? You cannot walk anywhere in the game without being spontaneously assaulted from the air every five minutes by a random bird. These do not provide the game experience with any additional challenge whatsoever but serve only as a nuisance. I often find myself spending more time looking up at the sky while trudging around in the bushes than looking for men on the ground with machine guns. 

Mouse acceleration. This game has it BAD. It cannot be disabled, despite editing game configuration files and trying just about every fix one can find on Google at this point. There is a workaround if you have a mouse with adjustable DPI which is not a fix in any sense but works quite nicely as a temporary workaround until (hopefully) Ubisoft fixes the issue. If you set the in-game mouse sensitivity all the way down and set the DPI on your mouse to max (or whatever is comfortable to you), the mouse acceleration will be saturated each time you move the mouse and in turn, it will be negated. However, when entering menus, your mouse will be far to sensitive so this works best with mice that have on-the-fly DPI adjustment. 

There are many other small bugs, such as ropes getting embedded in rock faces and not allowing you to scale any higher while grappling. These things are annoying but can be dealt with. Overall, I would definitely recommend this game if you plan on playing co-op. There's just something hilariously awesome about tromping around and exploding things with a friend, or tag teaming outposts after formulating a long, thought out strategy that never seems to go as you planned. 

TL;DR: It has its annoyances, but it's way too much fun to pass up. Highly recommended.


Original review:
I really would love to give this game a glowing review but, unfortunately, I have not been able to play it. As soon as the game starts, I am presented with a black screen and a crash before reaching the menu. 

Like many other poor console ports, this game is simply not ready for the PC.

The gameplay is virtually identical with its frat-boy protagonist, outposts, hunting and crafting, and missions that seem like a chore that takes you away from the real fun of the game. The real reason to purchase this game is for the co-op. Drop-in/drop-out (with a reload) co-op allowing full access to the map in its entirety with all missions and events fully accessible takes this game from an ok sequel to an awesome evolution of an already great game. It adds a level of polish that makes it everything Far Cry 3 should have been.

Now, the things that annoy me. For one, they still have not fixed the "black screen" crash issue. I know it has been fixed for some but it hasn't for me, despite Ubisoft's patch and insulting comments about making sure I meet the minimum requriements. I can get the game to run but only after several launch and crash attempts do I actually get to the main menu. 

Also, eagles. Ubisoft, why? You cannot walk anywhere in the game without being spontaneously assaulted from the air every five minutes by a random bird. These do not provide the game experience with any additional challenge whatsoever but serve only as a nuisance. I often find myself spending more time looking up at the sky while trudging around in the bushes than looking for men on the ground with machine guns.

review:
Beautiful graphics, ridiculously fun gameplay, and some of the most interesting characters I've seen in video games.

Plus I can hunt goats with rocket launchers.




That being said, I now have a fear of birds.  Whoever decided to include killer birds in this game was pure evil.

Solid game, great graphics, great story, I'm loving every second of this game.

Saw a family being attacked by an eagle.
Killed the eagle.
Family scared of me.
Told me to leave.
I walk away and look back.
Another eagle swoops down, grabs dad, and throws off the mountain.
Dad dissapeared into clouds.
Family blames me.
Blessings of Mara upon you.

10/10 would eagle again.

review: Loved FC3, and initially, liked FC4. The map is beautiful and huge. In FC3 I often found myself laughing maniacally over silly things and being sidetracked was often a hoot. This game is not nearly as much fun and while the music is lovely, it lacks the edge of FC3. I've played 37 hours of FC4 and the repetitive aspects of this game are just pissing me off. Mindless running from A to B while being attacked by various wildlife just becomes annoying and kills the game for me. I would like to get some main quests under my belt and get a real feel for the direction of the game but I keep getting sidetracked by repetitive crap that just stops me caring. Quests last a lot less time than it takes to actually get there. For a first playthrough (on normal) I'm not finding it very challenging. I'm a PC  gamer and have a keyboard and mouse with lots of keys and would like to use them. However, I find the interface clunky to say the least.  That said, riding elephants may actually be worth the full price of this game. Normally, I'm obsessive about completing a first runthrough, but I'm going to play someting else for a while. In hindsight, I'd wait for the price to drop.

review:
If you liked FC3 then you'll probably like this game as well. Gameplay is quite similar to FC3 but the story and the landscape is completely different. As for the story I won't spoil anything, the graphics on the other hand are very good. Animals have a nice fur with some wacky effects, the mountains in the distance look amazing and the rest of the graphics are nice as well. 
There are some very nice changes related to driving, for example you can shoot whilst driving your car. And of course you can ride around on an elephant, which is truely amazing!
Therefore I would recommend this game if you liked the previous FC games and would like a slight improved FC3 with a different story and atmosphere.

review:
This is an awesome game, definitely recommend.  It runs really well also on my system i5 2500k OC, gtx 670, 16 gb ram. 
The story is good so far although I'm only at the beginning.  There is so much stuff to do and lots of exploring.  Its like skyrim with guns and vehicles.  Riding the elephant is super fun and something new.

There is a very high amount of wildlife in this game and most of it is hostile from eagles that divebomb you to snakes that bite you out of nowhere to rihnos that charge you if you are too close.  Also the badgers are very fierce, they don't mess around.  

Haven't tried online at all so no comments on that.

review:
*First Impressions Review*

I was never hugely into Far Cry 3. I thought there were a lot of great things about the game (the combat, the visuals, the late-game skills), but there were a lot of things that kept it from really clicking with me (environmental navigation was boring and tedious, it took way too long for the skill-tree to open up the really fun skills, roughly 90% of the voice-acting was rubbish, almost every story aspect was lazily-written [and the parts that were good were few and far between]) and with all that in mind, I was very cautious about Far Cry 4.

So far, this is the game that deserves to be dubbed "Skyrim with guns" or at least, far more deserving than its predecessor. Yes, much like the previous entry, Far Cry 4 has some truly atrocious caricatures masquerading as characters (which largely outnumber the game's few good characters [Pagan Min is a hoot, and Troy Baker does a wonderful job bringing him to life]), yes a large portion of skills have been ported wholesale from the last game, yes the story is dull (so far, haven't finished it yet [though I never cared about the story in Far Cry 3 in the first place]) and the fact that I still can't skip the (mostly) awful dialogue in this game puts me in a sour mood, but at least when I'm set loose into the absolutely beautiful game world that is Kyrat, I know that whatever activity I'm about to take place in will cheer me right back up again.

The single best thing I can say about this game (or at least, the thing I can't stop having a blast with) is just how fantastic getting around the environment feels. In Far Cry 3, I routinely took shortcuts down hills and slopes, and because of the (I felt it was) unpolished nature of the sandbox, I would randomly go tumbling down what appeared to be easily traversable terrain and lose large chunks of health, or worse, die. In Far Cry 4, I've only ever had an unfortunate tumble down a hill once, and to be fair, it was a steep, steep hill. Even better is the addition of the new grappling hook, which lets you ascend/descend cliffs and swing across gorges to access some hard to reach areas, or just take super quick shortcuts. Additionally, the wingsuit (which was one of the best things about Far Cry 3) takes way less time to unlock this time around. Whereas Far Cry 3 required you to be a good halfway into the game to unlock the suit, Far Cry 4 gives you the option to buy it less than three hours in, and considering the urge I get to leap off of every cliff I see (sometimes even with cliffs I just took the time to climb up), it was a wonderful decision to give this toy to play with early.

Other improvements made over the previous game include a much better economy, a reworked stim system (there aren't nearly as many arbitrary stims this time around), improved outpost liberations, better vehicles (the little ramshackle helicopter is so much fun it's almost criminal), a much more varied environment (thanks to the verticality of the map layout), and elephant riding, which never stops being both hilariously funny, and insanely empowering. 

Far Cry 4 might just be more of Far Cry 3, but that's a great thing in my book. To me, it doesn't feel like I'm getting a rehashed Far Cry 3 with some new bits and bobs; it feels like I'm getting the game I wanted Far Cry 3 to be. Think Just Cause 1 vs. Just Cause 2. Essentially the same game, but the second one took all the ideas from the first game and improved upon them to the point of making Just Cause 1 entirely obsolete. I definitely recommend giving Far Cry 4 a look, it’s a f*cking blast!

review:
i like it when some people write bad reviews just because their computer cant run the game proparly..
dont cry about the game being broken or uplay to fix it... get a better computer (@the guy with the black screen problem, or the mouse acc prob)

The game works perfect,
Great animation , you can see an improvment from the previous game ,
alot more weapons , bigger map , new animals to hunt (i feel bad for killing all those rhinos)
yes , you wont have a bad guy like vaas anymore (which is sad) but the new bad guy is also awesome !
Story is epic , and well.. again to the map , such a beautiful view everywhere you go, or fly with your little heli.

there is nothing else to say basicly.. im glad i pre ordered the gold edition , one of the best pre orders i made in the last 2 years.

i havnt finished the game yet , because im still enjoying all the stuff around.
but so far i recommend to all who can to get the game!
9/10

review:
Seem super-buggy right now.  I couldn't get my character to walk / move backwards in any way.  In the first mission, I got to the part where you climb a rope.  I couldn't go up (or down).  In fact, I couldn't even do anything after I grabbed the rope, other than bounce back and forth off the rocks.  I tried various repelling tactics, but nothing changed.

I can't recommend this game right now.  And when studios push out buggy games before they've been adequately tested, they're going to suffer with well-deserved negative feedback.  And this is the most expensive game I've ever played.  I recommend waiting a year or two for the developers to come out with enough patches, and for the price to drop.

review:
This game is way better than the previous Far Cry 3.  The graphics are not just better, but the entire world is too.  Even though I am sure the map is smaller than 3's, the new verticality makes it seem bigger.  
The characters are a lot more likeable.  Instead of an psycopathic pirate who dies half way through, Far Cry 4 features the colorful dictator Pagan Min, who will have you questioning whose side is the good side.  
Gameplay is also better.  The Gyrocopter, grapple hook, and weapons add more first person fun than I ever experienced in any previous Far Cry.  

Of course, not everything is perfect:
The crafting system is still here, though items are easier to craft now.  Syringes autocraft, but require a skill to do so.
Skills are also still here, but require skill points to level up instead of leveling up as an achievement.  Skill Points are spent like currency, where all the first level skills cost 1 point. second level 2 points, etc.
The missions aren't always as great too.  There are missions that will require you to hunt, fetch, and diliver, but with mountains in the way of checkpoints, traversing through Kyrat is more fun than Far Cry 3.

That last (and best) thing about Far Cry 4 is the ability of customization.  The HUD is completly cuztomizable, bing able to choose what to show, what to hide, and what to limit.  
And if that wasn't enough, the settings also allow you RESET OUTPOSTS.  Personally, the biggest problme with FC3 was once I had taken over all the outposts, there were no more pirates to kill, which meant no more game to be played.  In Far Cry 4, if you have liberated all outposts, you can reset them and take them over AGAIN.  And again.  And again.

At the end, Far Cry 4 is the best this series has seen so far, but there is still room for improvement for Far Cry 5.
8/10

review:
THIS GAME IS AMAZING..........BUT
As of right now it is unplayable.  I have sli 670's and a i7 and max this game out no prob with shadows at very high instead of ultra and Txaax2 instead of x4.  There is a bug that makes the shadows completely black.  I have searched and people say turn hbao+ to ssao and it fixes it but for me it does not.  Also the stuttering is gamebreaking to me.  It kills the immersion.  In a month or so when it's hopefully fixed I will reccomend this but as of right now I cannot.  


IF ANYONE KNOWS A FIX BESIDES TURNING SSAO ON FOR THE SHADOWS AND FOR THE STUTTERING PLEASE INFORM ME.
Great Game But, Coop sucks.   Wanted to go through campain with friend. Not Just Side Quest What a waste of my time and money

review:

if you are looking for the depth and all around story development of Far Cry 3 this isnt a good choice to purchase. I played Far Cry 3 and it was one of my favorite games ever, because of this I pre ordered Far Cry 4. The Story is OK, but is nowhere near up to my expectations. It is just like a waterdowned story of far cry 3 with some added new 'feature'. Good game but not "great".

review: the multi-player is like a really bad, sad version of cowboys and indians.... way to mess up the best multiplayer franchise I've played to date. This was a huge huge waste of money. The ping is high for games, and you spend most of the time waiting in lobby for people to join, then you wait for the countdown, then you wait for the game to load, when you wait for it to start. you spend more time waiting in each game that the actual time the game takes to play. No joke.... I  was wondering why no one on my friends list bought this game.... now i know why. And as far as "open-world" goes, mine sweeper, is more open-world than this is.

review: I have no idea why people would say the multiplayer is unbalanced because one side has bows and they are underpowered... you can go invisble and use your explosive arrows to blow up an vehichle and use the blink arrow to tele out of danger, behind and enemy to kill them, or straight to the bombsite and defuse the mobility with the red syringe is just ridiculous too nobody can hit you. I love the multiplayer at first i hated it but then i learned the tricks and i fell in love both sides are pretty equal (if you know how to play them) and even if you switch between being the guys with guns and the guys with arrows so i dont see how it even matters. So the multiplay is defenitly a PRO. The campaign has more scavangeing and hunting wich is something i loved in far cry 3 the story isnt too bad but i cant say too much because im not that far in, the outposts are about the same but the fortresses are awesome and challenging. The coop is pretty fun if you can voice chat with who you are with its fun to go do outposts and especially fortresses with another person but there is somethings they could work on in coop but its about what i expected for farcry coop. I have loved all the past farcry games and i love this one!

review:
As an avid player of the Far cry series, I want to reccomend this game. 

I REALLY [i]want[/i] to reccomend this game.

But I can't. 

After a large investiture of both time and money, I was rather excited to play on release day. Sure, I had to run it through some silly recursive (launch uplay from steam. uplay wants to launch steam to play the game...) DRM crap, but I was willing to overlook that if the game was at least the quality level of FC3. So I booted it up  and got set to live a harrowing tale of adventure in the himalayas...


...and got a black screen instead.  I let it sit for a bit, figuring it might take awhile to load, but no. Just a black screen.
I verified the files and tried again. Black screen. Verified again. Black screen again. After several attempts, it became rather apparent that [u]something[/u] was wrong, so I googled it. 

Apparently, an unsupported USB device (read: pretty much every USB device ever, except perhaps storage drives) is causing the crash. For the record: this is 2014, nearly 2015. USB technology has been in fairly common use since ~1998, and was on the market as early as '95. While my computer still retains a PS/2 port for a keyboard, it does NOT have one for a mouse, and after disabling every USB driver possible without losing the keyboard and mouse, the game STILL crashes on startup.

Ubisoft has really dropped the ball on this one, I'm sad to say. However, they claim to be aware of the problem and promise a fix in a "future" patch. I may change my rating then, but I'll be remembering this.

I've tried it 12 times, therefore the game currently rates at -2/10.



TL:DR Spent 2+ days preloading it and $80+ on the gold version, just so I could look at a black screen.

I REALLY [i]want[/i] to reccomend this game.

But I can't. 

After a large investiture of both time and money, I was rather excited to play on release day. Sure, I had to run it through some silly recursive (launch uplay from steam. uplay wants to launch steam to play the game...) DRM crap, but I was willing to overlook that if the game was at least the quality level of FC3. So I booted it up  and got set to live a harrowing tale of adventure in the himalayas...


...and got a black screen instead.  I let it sit for a bit, figuring it might take awhile to load, but no. Just a black screen.
I verified the files and tried again. Black screen. Verified again. Black screen again. After several attempts, it became rather apparent that [u]something[/u] was wrong, so I googled it. 

Apparently, an unsupported USB device (read: pretty much every USB device ever, except perhaps storage drives) is causing the crash. For the record: this is 2014, nearly 2015. USB technology has been in fairly common use since ~1998, and was on the market as early as '95. While my computer still retains a PS/2 port for a keyboard, it does NOT have one for a mouse, and after disabling every USB driver possible without losing the keyboard and mouse, the game STILL crashes on startup.

Ubisoft has really dropped the ball on this one, I'm sad to say. However, they claim to be aware of the problem and promise a fix in a "future" patch. I may change my rating then, but I'll be remembering this.

I've tried it 12 times, therefore the game currently rates at -2/10.



TL:DR Spent 2+ days preloading it and $80+ on the gold version, just so I could look at a black screen.

review:
This game is good, as to be expected.  Probably the biggest thing that I've noticed in this game compared to FC3 is the difficulty. Although I love FC3, there were quite a few issues, the difficulty being one of them.  I'm sorry, it's just that Far Cry 3 was piss easy, even on the hardest difficulty setting.  FC4 is quite a bit harder, but not to the point of being ridiculous.  I much prefer the Himilayan setting over that of the island from FC3, due to the fact that 90% of sandbox games take place either in a city, or on an island.  

Other Pros:

-Game cut down on the chatter from the main protaginost; although Jason wasn't the worst character in gaming, his need to comment on every little thing was quite annoying

-Not only new weapons, but more versatility in them, unlike in FC3 where you just stuck to like 3 guns for the first half and 3 others for the second.

-Not a white male power fantasy (they even poke fun at the franchise with co-op character Hurk)

-Being able to use the Robocop gun (IDC IF ITS FROM BD, I STILL LOVE IT)

-More things to do in general

-Little things (auto-crafting, slightly improved hunting, random encounters etc.)

CONS:

-Less memorable characters

-Somehow there's even a thinner plot than before

-No Cybersharks

-NO CYBERSHARKS

_NO CYB3R5HARK5555555555555555555555

review:
Ubisoft...really...get your shit together! What the hell is wrong with your QA-Department (if you have any...)? This game refuses to start (crashing after the splashscreen right after hitting the Play-button) because i have a f**ing Razer Orbweaver plugged in... This thing is nothing more than a small keyboard! Even disabling the Razer Synapse-Software doesn´t fix the issue.
After you get it to run, you discover that Mouse Acceleration is On by default and can´t be disabled, even if the Menu says it´s off. 
Talking about Acceleration...what kind of Graphics Acceleration Card(s) would you need to get a good perfomance out of this game? Would 4 GTX980 do? Well, i could only afford one, and it isn´t doing the job (on 1920x1080). Random FPS-Drops way below 60 fps, than shooting back up to above 60, and down it goes again...what the hell? And what´s with all that stuttering that causes me to crash my vehicles in time critical missons over and over again? GNNNARRHHH!!

Is it a good game? Sure! If you liked Far Cry 3, you will have a hell of a lot of fun with this one. It looks beautiful, it conveys the feeling of the island even better than it´s predicessor...but in the current state, it´s just barely playable with way to many (gamebraking) bugs, which is inexcusable coming from a developer/publisher like Ubisoft...but i think they already know that.

P.S.: Yes, i am running the game on the latest patch with the all the latest drivers for my system. Just so you know :)

review:
Almost every scripted game event seems to be broken for me (GTx 680 4gb, i7, 16gb Ram).  The stopgap solution seems to be spamming alt-tab which somehow makes events trigger.  This applies to loading screens, dialogue, missions,  level streaming, quest items, and random encounters.

After accepting the ALT+TAB curse as part of my gameplay experience, it's still been a bumpy ride.  There are so many situations where you're ambushed, or trying to save some people - and even when you're alt+tab spamming, you'll find yourself in endless randomly disadvantaged situations (enemies suddenly materialize all around you when they should have spawned in your field of view as you approach, getting eaten by invisible wolves)

To top this off, if your mission glitches or you die from the game bugging out, you have to sit and watch the loading screen for 2 minutes as you furiously spam alt-tab.  

I'm not even going to bother going into the other issues.  Stay away from this game on PC, at least until theres an acceptable patch.  Everyone seems to love it on ps4 and xbone.

review:
OK. If you get this game there are a few things you need to do before you actually play it. 
1. Make sure all drivers are up to date.
2. Turn of mouse acceleration. It doesnt work if you disable it in the options. (Go to Location below)
3. Go to "My Documents\My Games\Far Cry 4\[account id name]\GamerProfile.xml" and Search for “DisableLoadingMip0="0"” and change the second 0 to a 1, so it should read “DisableLoadingMip0="1"”
4. You might also want to disable motion blurr in the same text file.

After you do these things Far Cry 4 should run without massive stuttering.
Although some people are still having problems with black screens and crashing.
This is a GOOD game. It is just plagued by Massive optimization problems.
I recommend this game with caution because people are having so much trouble with it.

As for my gameplay review

Pros- 
Gyrocopter

Cons-
Not enough Gyrocopters

Conclusion-
Needs more Gyrocopters

7/10

review:
Being one of many who preordered the game with high expectations, my hopes were surely crushed. My computer had the power to run the game on ultra setting comfortably at over 60 fps but the game just looks LIKE farcry 3 and not better. (this is personal preference. This might be due to the setting of Farcry 3 being a tropical island so it was just more beautiful). But maybe this is just a new game opinion that will change over time as the beauty of the himalayas 'breaks in'. 


Finally for the pricetag of $75, I dont think the game justifies it's cost. Don't get me wrong this is by no means a bad game, I might even call it great. Maybe it's my high expectations fueled by the outrage that a pair of gtx 780s are not being able to give me the experience that people with inferior card arrays are getting. Or maybe Farcry 3 was just a hard act to follow. I think this game belongs in the more traditional 50-60 dollar range. 

CHANGED! I am giving a negative review based upon my experience so far. Should it change and my problems solved, I will change my review for the better. However right now my consumer experience isn't that great. Any helpful insight to improve this will be apreciated. I love the franchise and want it to do well. I want to love farcry 4.


UPDATE!!!! mANY OF THE PROBLEMS i HAD WITH THE GAME HAVE BEEN ADRESSED AND MY user experience is now positive. As a result, I have been able to enjoy the game more so than before as there was some problem with my graphics card driver. With the issues fixed, The game looks beautiful and is indeed in the running for a masterpeice. And now thanks to the game I am in posession of 15 copies of vintage porn, 20 condoms and 30 used ones and the pure hillariousness surrounding the eagles divebombing you outta nowehere. I guess this might start the new RKO thing EAGLE OUTTA NOWHERE!!!! WATHC OUT WATCH OUT WATCH OUT! 

This is indeed a great game and I would reccomend it but ubisoft still needs to get their shit up.

Maybe it's my high expectations fueled by the outrage that a pair of gtx 780s are not being able to give me the experience that people with inferior card arrays are getting. Or maybe Farcry 3 was just a hard act to follow. I think this game belongs in the more traditional 50-60 dollar range. 

CHANGED! I am giving a negative review based upon my experience so far. Should it change and my problems solved, I will change my review for the better. However right now my consumer experience isn't that great. Any helpful insight to improve this will be apreciated. I love the franchise and want it to do well. I want to love farcry 4.

review:
If you are expecting something entirely different from Far Cry 3 (which a lot of these reviewers seem to be) then you will be sadly disappointed. It's honestly a lot like FC3. The mechanics are the same, animations of skinning and picking leaves are the same, and the whole idea of liberating camps is the same. And you know what? It's still an effing BLAST! I am so overwhelmed with things to do and goals to meet. 

My husband and I have been playing co-op all day and I have to say, I have never played such a fun and rewarding co-op game. We have been hunting and upgrading our gear, liberating posts, opening up the map together. It's all been great. Minor glitches such as he cannot see vehicles on the road and sometimes he dies from one bite of a honey badger (that HAS to be a glitch, right?). 

Point blank -- it's a Far Cry game. They decided to stick with the same mechanics of the last Far Cry game probably because of its success. If you're looking for something brand new and groundbreaking don't bother. If you want do play Far Cry again with some new stuff (entirely new story and map, new characters, new adventures, new animals, co-op) then please give it a shot. You won't be disappointed. I have played Far Cry 1-4 now and loved them all.

review:
Far Cry 4 is fun and I'm enjoying the new missions and characters.  

That aside, the Co-op isn't what I was expecting.  I was thinking it was going to be more like Saints Row (both players are able to do the whole game together) but when I joined a co-op game, we can only explore and do some side missions (like supply drops and karma events).  The whole Campaign isn't available cooperatively which really bums me out. 

I would still recommend it though as a single-player game but if you're wanting to play Co-op I would wait for it to go on sale, honestly.

Very mixed feelings about the game so far. The graphics are beautiful and the cut-scenes are very well done (although a "skip" button would be helpful, especially later on when replaying). Game play is similar to FC3 but that's not a bad thing.

What makes the game essentially unplayable at the moment is the inability to save when you want to and the tendancy of the game to not restore checkpoints on reloads. This means you are replaying the same bits over and over for no reason.

Worse is the complete stuffup on keyboard movement. There is simply no way to step backwards (seriously Uplay, seriously?) and other keys just plain don't work which leaves you stuck on ropes with no way to go up or down. Until this very basic bug is fixed I just can't recommend the game, which is a real shame give how addictive and enjoyable FC3 was.

Poor start, this game shouldn't have been relased yet.

review:
Dive into Kyrat, a stunning atmospheric and gorgeous fictional place, in which you play Ajay, who fights with the rebel group 'Golden Path' against Dictator Pagan Min. 

While the story is very linear, one can chose between story paths and therefore who leads the golden path, ultimately resulting in two separate endings. Even though this is fun, I would not say this is a selling point of the game.

As mentioned in my opening sentence, it is rather the amazing visuals and locations which make this game so incredible. 

I have played the game to 100 % completion three times and have 200 hours in it, which shows that one can definitely fall in love with Kyrat and play this game multiple times, if one wishes to do so. However - and this is based upon my 200 hours in it - there definitely are quite some bugs in this game, but if you look passed this, you will have a great time.

If you are a fan of Single Player games, this one is for you. 

If you are more into co-op, Far Cry 4 only allows you to attempt outposts and other aspects but not the story, which in my opinion is very sad, but was luckily fixed in the future games of the series.

However, if you are a fan of the co-op mode, I highly recommend the DLC 'Valley of the Yetis', which I have played through three times, as it takes place in an entirely new location and with a short but sweet story and is lots of fun to play together.

10/10. My favorite game in the Far Cry franchise and one of my favorite games of all time.

review:
People keep saying that this game is like Far Cry 3.  I bad thing? HELL NO! That game was amazing, aside from one biome throughout the whole island.

Pros:
-Graphics are amazing
-Map is massive
-So much to do
-KARMA :D
-Lots of new weapons
-The multiplayer is quite fun I have to say
-New animals
-I love being able to go to the mountains and in the snow, that shits fun!
-Strongholds
-Co-op

Cons:
-Some stuttering
-Some what boring story
-No classes in multiplayer?
-UPLAY >:c

Thats all! I haven't been able to play a lot of this game sadly, school and work, but if you guys liked Far Cry 3, get this game :D

review:
I see alot of negative reviews about this game.

Even cod advanced warfare got alot higher reviews, even with less changes from prev cod games than changes made on Far Cry 4

Well now. Don't forget about all other games getting top ratings all the time and with each release.  Not to mention Call of duty, battlefield, Metro, assassins creed (well, not black flag, that game had alot new stuff going on. ) 
But cmon, the list is huge..

I loved far cry 3. It was AWESOME.
Now facry 4 is different in alot more aspects than the list mentioned above. Still people criticize Far Cry 4 even MORE than call of duty advanced warfare?

Advanced warfare, ofc, new guns ( more like new skins to the old guns. ) 
U get the advanced combat suits. And thats it. Thats everything. (New engine aswell)

Cmon, we all know people would be whining like babies if they changed too much about far cry, and why is that? Because far cry 3 was a fking bomb. 


Try to enjoy this new game, if you keep following the main stream of reviews to a new game then you'll never be able to enjoy it as it is. And i'd say that Far Cry 4 is a improvement.  If it's not better than Far Cry 3 then you're just disliking the new missions/world(Well thats my opinon)

review:
I noticed alot of people haven't gotten the game to work so I've been pretty lucky lately.  The setting and enviornment really puts the game together and keeps making me want to play more and more of it.  I thought the setting in Far Cry 3 was great in the tropics but now in the Himalayas, it's really a blessing.  With experience from Far Cry 2,3 and now 4, I've seen BIG improvements with everything.  Definitely reccomend this game but Uplay really needs to fix this error with people not being able to startup.  Story's great. Character's great. Enviornment's great. Game's great. 

"Skyrim with guns." 10/10

review:
If you have an AMD card -- READ THIS

I have a fairly respectable PC: i5-3570 w/16GB RAM and two Radeon 8750s hooked up with Crossfire.  I've never had an issue running a game smoothly until Far Cry 4.  Even at 1280x720, I suffer through frequent framerate stutters and screen tearing.  It is beyond just a visual annoyance -- it is detrimental to game play.  I guarantee you, if you are using an AMD card, you WILL die in this game due to framerate hiccups.

Until Ubisoft and/or AMD releases a patch to correct these issues, I consider this game unplayable (unless you have an nVidia card).  If I could get my money back, I would.

So just got the game and before you can play the game you have to sign up for this "uplay" bullshit, after that I lunched the game and it failed to lunch ten different times I've uninstalled and reinstalled and still failed to lunch I dont know what I did wrong but for fifty bucks this game should work.

review: Far Cry 3 was one of my favourite games and this one tops that easily. A new and invigorating story along with a beautiful landscape to explore leaves you with lots to do. Animal hunting, crafting, and the bell towers all keep Far Cry 4 feeling like a sequel and provide loads of fun. One major change is the inability to access the entire map without activating the bell towers. I found that disappointing as I was no longer able to go exploring for fun because I had to follow the story. Fortunately, the story is great and I didn't mind working on that first before exploring all of Kyrat. If you're a Far Cry fan as I am, I highly recommend getting this game.

review:
Ayye let me just say though all these neagetive reviews have real points, I still reccomend this game.
It really is alot like far cry 3, which is obviously sortof sad because we wanted a true sequel.
But let me tell you whats new and great about this game.

The biggest difference is the new land of (Tebbet?) 
On high settings its aww-inspiring beutiful with the mountains, foggy valleys, fields of flowers, much differnt than the tropical jungle of far cry 3. And due to the land having so much elevation with its mountains and valleys, its much easier to use that squierl suit to bascially fly any where.

And if you can fly downward, theres usually a grapple hook spot near by that lets you go up.
There is only grapple areas in certain sections, BUT they are very common and it seems the devs put them in the best places. Like if you can drive up to a mountain that only has one path to get up, on the opposite side they probably put a hook to help you incase you came from a differnt direction. Its actually a pretty cool mechanic.

The weapons are basically the same, but for me it doesnt change that much since I think the bow is the games best aspect (fire arrows, bomb arrows, plus a weapon thats medium long range and always silenced? What else would you need)
Also a neet touch is now instead of just buying weapons and attachments for thme (which you can do with some guns) guns that already have a bundle of attachments come with a name and must be earned through the games various events. This makes getting weapons we want more rewarding and incourages us to do those random mini map events.

The story is just another tribal war scenerio exept its between a bad guy with an army who loves red hats, and a terrorist organization that doesnt like their "leader".  The story goes that your parents founded the terrorist and they sent you back unkowingly to finish their buisness. Thats really all Ill tell you to not spoil anything.

Overall the game offers tons of stuff to do in the most beutiful far cry environment yet. The ONLY downside, which is a biggy, is that its everything far cry 3 was and more. 
Im still having a blast.

Side note: If you throw rocks at npcs more than a few times they will attempt to shoot you, I donot remember if this worked in the third game.

review:
11/19/2014 9am+ As I was playing ~

*Stopped and saw a native NPC down on the front of his truck, he had hit a boar.
*Decided to fool around with the NPC and used blowtorch to see if he would get hurt.
*Later on he did and went running away scared. 
*Followed him and used my blowtorch on him and fixed his truck and my buggy.
*Tried the blowtorch on a nearby tree and it caught fire and set the area ablaze.
*Watched as the fire spread near the NPC as he was taking cover near the bush.

10/10 Great experience of fooling around XD

*Followed him and used my blowtorch on him and fixed his truck and my buggy.

review:
I was really excited for this game, and I will have to say I am a bit dissapointed. I have a mid-range laptop, capable of running medium graphics at 35 fps on Far Cry 3. I have 8 GBs of RAM, Intel Core-i5 4200, 2.5 Ghz, and decent intel integrated graphics (better that the recommended system), so I expected to run this game on low to medium graphics, with little lag but this was not the case. I turned on minimum graphics and I was getting about 20 fps. I found out it improved if I turned on some other settings, but it only jumped up to about 25 fps. This frame rate is bad, but would be playable, until you jump on a vehicle. I was doing the first quest, and wanted to get the tower faster so I jumped on a 4x4, and as soon as I started driving, it was almost impossible due to bad frame rate. I looked into it, and apparently lag is an issue on lap-tops, so hopefully they developers will release a patch to make it more compatible. Also the look mechanics are very clunky, but that may be a result of poor frame rate.

The Good: interesting characters, good story, nice map, a lot more animal/ vehicle mechanics than FC3

The Bad: bad fps on laptops, reused animations and models

I wouldn't recommend this if you do not have a very high end lap-top, as of now, but if they fix that, I would recommend it, also if you do not have a laptop. I suppose this is why everyone pirates Ubisoft games, because you never know what problems will be left in their final product. I am excited to play it, because the last one was so much fun.

Edit: I have played the game for about 40 hours now, and the game has grown on me. There seems to have been some small changes, and my fps went up. There are still a lot of graphical bugs, but it doesn't affect gameplay too much. I found the story and gameplay fun, and co-op is a blast. I would now recommend it, if you have a good computer.

review:
So i've finished Act1 and loving the game so far. Have had zero issues, runs fine. Mechanics are the same as with Far Cry 3 but the art, characters and scenery / environment have been taken to a whole new level. Can highly recommend the PC version.

Don't know about all the forum bitching thats going on in the Far Cry 4 Discussion Boards, ignore them. This game deserves so much more.

review: If you had a great time playing Far Cry 3 then there should be no reason you shouldn't enjoy this game. From what I can tell early on is that it is very similar to 3. Which isn't really a bad thing. Out side of a new location, more weapons, new charcters it is very Far Cry 3 ish with its systems and things of that nature. So far I am really enjoying it. Taking place in the Himalayas makes for some wonder views as well. I think I like this location better than the tropics of that last. So bundle up, and settle in for some more Far Cry fun.

review:
yes this game is a lot like Far Cry 3... Its Far Cry  for crying out loud. That being said. This game looks fucking awesome. whats new,, well for one you can set your car on auto pilot, so you can aim and shoot things, and the grappling climbing is pretty cool too. graphics look amazing. The open world wow... Just you try and kill a Rhino with a AK and see what happens... If you didnt like Far Cry 3 then you probably wont like this. there  is so much to do in this game, and its new so yeah 60 bucko, if you have a ps4 or xboxone its 65. if you dont like the price wait for the summer sale. trust me price will drop. if you really want the game and cant afford it get a fuckin job.

my Rig... GTX 780 TI, 32 gigs 2666 of unnecessary ram, i7 4930k cpu, 27 inch 2k res most settings on ultra, not everything game runs smooth, still im sure it runs better on my pc than ps4, and xboxone

review:
Besides the small problems I have had using an AMD card, this game runs very well. nice even 60 FPS, default High video settings. 

As for the enjoyability, its better than ever. Combining the RPG elements from 3, with the flamable and entertaining enviornment of 2, this game really wraps the series together. The story isnt perfect, but the antagonist is nearly as entertaining as Vaas from Far Cry 3

review:
I am only 3 hours into this game and have certainly not had the Full Far Cry 4 Experience. but... This game is AWESOME!!!!  Take everything you loved about the previous Far Cry games and imagine it perfected. Take everything you hated about the previous Far Cry games and imagine most of those problems gone. That is Far Cry 4.  The Graphics are absolutely gorgeous and the gameplay is mostly smooth. The story (so far) is great and they really have introduced some really memorable characters.  The antagonist is even more sadistic than Vaas was in Far Cry 3 which I thought would be impossible.  The map is huge. I have only explored a small portion of it and I still feel just this little tiny little area on the map still has many many hours of gameplay to offer.

I have an Nvidia 755m graphics card and was able to start the game off with most settings on ultra, however, I did have to turn settings to be mostly medium after a few hours of playing. I am not sure if the reasonthe game started lagging because of the computer started overheating or because of something within the game engine not working, or because my computer just simply is not up to the specs to max the settings out.  Either way, It still looks incredible with medium settings and really won't subtract from the overall experience.

I have only explored a small portion of it and I still feel just this little tiny little area on the map still has many many hours of gameplay to offer.\n\nI have an Nvidia 755m graphics card and was able to start the game off with most settings on ultra, however, I did have to turn settings to be mostly medium after a few hours of playing. I am not sure if the reasonthe game started lagging because of the computer started overheating or because of something within the game engine not working, or because my computer just simply is not up to the specs to max the settings out.  Either way, It still looks incredible with medium settings and really won't subtract from the overall experience.", "timestamp_created": 1416409879, "timestamp_updated": 1417366077, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 4, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.526157379150390625", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
I love this game, some might not but to me Far Cry is really about exploring the world and blowing shit up. Yes, this games story might lack but the world is awesome. Then co - op, it is fantastic, so much fun being able to explore and blow shit up with your firends. Honestly I love this game if you liked Far Cry 3 you'll like this game. Oh yeah, go find a friend to really experience Kyrat. 9/10

PS: This game is hard to run, it's very graphically demanding.

review:
I met a merchant. I bought a gun and then an eagle came and killed the merchant.

I saw a hostage. I saved the hostage and got a reward but then an eagle came and killed the hostage.

I stumbled upon a man needing help with his car. I fixed his car and then an eagle came and killed the man.

Game is like Birdemic. 10/10

review:
"Black Screen" 

Well this is interesting, sitting here staring at a black screen and thinking to myself I paid $110 to have the opportunity to sit here and stare at blackness, just awesome!
I think the companies that releases this sort of rubbish should be held accountable for their actions. 
One would think with the  amount of money that is involved in the gaming industry in today's society, that an experienced company would dare and be so bold as to insult their customer base by putting out a product that does not even run on a modern PC. 
When did the accumulation of wealth outweigh good customer service and the desire to deliver an excellent product to people ?
Anyway I am still looking forward to playing the game, one day I might get an opportunity, I think I might go and have a look at Utub , or surf the web. Happy gaming my fellow gamers.

review:
It is a very cool game,with an colorful atmosphere,very good optimezed in my opinion,if you want to relax and do awesome things based on an interesting and captivating storyline,this is the right game,It is better than Far Cry 3,with new vehicles,weapons and beautuful fairytale landscapes.I recomand this game,for those who love to drive trough a varied world with a lot of difrent things to do,all you have to do is to buy it:) Graphics are very detailed,it is all you need:).
To make an idea,on a i5,8gb ram,270x is working smooth,perfect on ultra with a 1080p resolution,and with an quad core,4gb ram,an 7770 is working on ultra with a 1366x768 resolution.

I hope i helped some people saying my opinion!
Thank`s for reading :D
Enjoy the game!

review:
นิยามสั้นๆ เกี่ยวกับเกมนี้ "เช่นเดียวกับในภาค 3 มันคือ Skyrim ที่มีปืน... และถูกขัดเกลาให้สนุกยิ่งขึ้น"

+ รูปแบบการเล่นหลักๆ เหมือนกับภาคก่อน แต่กะทัดรัดและเข้าถึงได้ง่ายกว่าเดิม
+ การขี่ช้างใน Far Cry 4 เจ๋งยิ่งกว่าขี่มังกรใน Skyrim ซะอีก โดยเฉพาะตอนเอางวงฟาดศัตรูลอยข้ามหลังคาบ้าน
+ Co-op ทั้งมันส์ ทั้งฮา และเพี้ยน ในหลอดเดียวกัน
+ ปืนครกเป็นอาวุธสุดยอดของความสะใจ ใช้แล้วจะพบกับพลังทำลายล้างอันวินาศสันตะโรที่เร้าใจสุดๆ
+ เฮฮามิใช่น้อย ถ้าได้เดินทางด้วยการเอาตะขอเกี่ยวไปกับเฮลิคอปเตอร์
+ แค่ตัวร้ายอย่าง Pegan Min เพียงคงเดียวก็คุมทั้งเกมได้อยู่หมัด ทำให้เนื้อเรื่องน่าติดตามเป็นอย่างยิ่ง

- Uplay ห่วย ทำเกมค้างบ่อยขณะเรียกใช้งาน ไม่สะดวกเอาซะเลย
- AI ทำอะไรเพี้ยนๆ เยอะ (ถึงทำแล้วจะฮาก็เถอะ)
- สัตว์ป่าในเกมเข้าขั้นอภิมหาดุ เจอทีไรก็ไล่ล่ายังกับเป็นศัตรูคู่แค้นกันมาตั้งแต่ชาติปางก่อน

review:
A worthy successor to Farcry 3. While some may say too much of this game feels like it's predessor I say so what! They included many of the things I loved about FC3 and added many more!  The game runs great for me and  I'm running it under bootcamp Windows 8 on my Mac Pro. It does struggle with the frame rate when maxed out on the highest resolution but dumb it down to 1940X1280 and she purrs like a bengal tiger. 

The thing that impresses me most about FC4 is it's beautiful and the animals are amazing. I took a good two hours before I even began the campaign just watching monkeys go about their day and annoying elephants and waching them go MENTAL on a town.. but maybe that's just what thrills me. The game has a reasonably interesting storyline, great voice acting, and an atmospheric immersive world which is brought to life by a great score. I would recommend you go out right now and buy this it may just prove to be the best shooter/RPG of all time.

review:
This game is awesome, just a big beautiful world with lots of stuff to explore. The characters are interesting and easy to relate to and the story is really good so far. Ive flown around in the mad max  helicopter, went hang gliding and tore shit up driving around on a four wheeler. Im getting good fps (80) at 1440p with everything set to medium except textures which i have on high. I have an i5-4670k 4.3ghz and 780ti sc. My only complaint is you have to play with a controller or cheap kb, gaming kb's make the game crash so until thats fixed i give it a 9/10.

EDIT: 10/10 now that they patched it now and my orbweaver works

review:
what.  the.  funk.  I bought this game thinking it was a finished playable product.  That is what I come to assume as a consumer... who paid money for an advertized item... that they were done making it.  I wish it was a law to let the consumers know they were not done making the funking thing but have to meet deadlines so they will sell you an unfinished and potentially unplayable and probably buggy game.

Yesireebob.  A maelstorm of crashes and graphics glitches galore later--I stopped to do some research on how to MAKE THIS GAME RUN without funking me in the ass.

review:
I loved Farcry 1, 2, 3, and to a degree, 4. I want to give this a "neutral" rating. For $90, which is what I paid for the season pass and this game though? Negative. Here's why:

1) The story falls very short of the first three games, especially when compared to 1 and 3. I feel like a child caught between mommy and daddy arguing. No decision is correct, someone is always pissed off, and while there are "consequences" to every action, I have to listen to an NPC chew me out at the end of every mission because I chose the lesser-loser situation. Not a fun factor.

2) The much flaunted CO-OP is pretty terrible. Your CO-OP buddy can only join to help you with outposts, herb gathering, and hunting missions. Your buddy is also limited to 150 meters before they disappear off the face of the earth. It's like walking in a world where only the first player can see anything, and the second player is stuck to stare into oblivion only to support you with a few extra bullets towards a goal which is already foolishly easy. Even on hard mode, the game struggles to challenge.

3) UBI: WHAT DID YOU DO TO MULTIPLAYER? One of the great aspects of Farcry 3 was the DM, TDM, and CTF modes. You had a great thing going there. It was a very nice tribute to old school competitive gaming. With this, you do NOT have DM, TDM, nor CTF. You have a messed up version of cowboys and indians where one side gets bows, one gets guns. Sure you can argue there are abilities, but as with every other game that has attempted asymetric combat, in the end, it leads to premade groups and utter frustration. Not to mention... the "indians" are severely underpowered. The average player who doesn't want to gather 5 of his buddies at the same time every night is underpowered because he's stuck in the hunter-gatherer stage of life.

The good though?

-graphics are nice
-story is decent (though not as strong as 3)
-decent characters.
-runs like absolute BUTTER (maxed). Great optimizations.
-Plenty to do.
-nice entry into the seamless coop arena, but it fell short. see above.
-lots of weapons to play with and variations to explore.


Overall, I give it a 6 of 10. Playing Farcry 3 spoiled me, and this is a rehash with a story line borderline dull, a multiplayer that made me want to shelve the game immediately, and $90 less in my pocket which I wish I would have researched more carefully. I would NOT have bought season pass knowing the COOP and the MP was so terrible (in terms of flexibility. Some people like cowboys and indians I guess), and would have heavily debated paying full price for the game. Likely would have waited until it was on sale.

It hurts to say this, because I love this franchise. Once again, UBI fails at multiplayer.

review:
It is early in the process but,I wanted to share my early thoughts on this one.It is a lot like FC3....that is a good thing in my book.It seems that a lot of players with newer machines are having performance issues....ie....stuttering,mouse problems etc.I have a 6 year old Q9650 and it runs fine on my GTX470.Of course I don't have to be able to see a bears eye lashes at 200 yards either.The story is excellent and so far the game play is good for ME.The vehicles handle about the same as before and the characters are interesting.I like the mountainous and snowy terrain a lot.The weapon system seems to work a little easier and the upgrades are fine.To repeat.....the machine I use runs this game well....not perfect.Anyone with a GTX 5-9 shoudn't be having many issues if it is a game problem.It is unfortunate that the industry concentrates on hardware instead of players.I know MANY more gamers privately that own 3-7 year old machines that have few issues with games period.So far the game is as expected .....very good ....I will update if things change for the better or worse.
    Edit:I am guessing that I am about a third of the way through the game and I MUST say I am having a blast.There is a LOT more content.The game is much more frenetic than the last one.For instance if you aren't paying attention when sniping you will get chewed on by any number of animals(which are far more aggressive and numerous).There are far more random incursions to earn rep etc.The copter is a blast to use as long as you don't go to high and stay there.(You will go boom)The story updates are not stationary and you have to play the game to get to Story missions which I find awesome.I heartily recommend this game to anyone fond of the last one.10\10

review:
(Based on around 6 hours of Single Player.)

Generally, if you liked FARCRY 3 you will like this. Many things have stayed generally the same gameplay wise. Clearing Belltowers and Outposts are just as amusing as before.

Weapons are... not amazing but not bad. Its is still very satisfying to land headshots and remove eyes with well placed arrows and throwing knives. Obviously six hours in is not saying much when it comes to what you can get your hands on later.

Animals are more annoying this time about. At first I appreciated things being agressive but when a small animal starts mauling you while you are trying to stealth an outpost it gets very old very fast. As amusing as it is to watch a single animal kill many soldiers, it brings up another point. They are strong. Generally when I throw three knives into a medium sized cat I would expect it to die. 

Characters have very good first impressions, but they loose their spark after a while. It is like seeing an amazing firework... then seeing it again... and again... ... again... and so on. Though some characters do hold more interest than others. I wish the main antagonist showed up more, though he is far more present than Vaas (FC3).

Looking at other reviews it seems FPS drops are an issue, though I never experienced these issues personally.

TL;DR: If you liked FC3 there is a very good chance that you will like FC4. If you have had not prior experience with FARCRY you may want to put some more thought into buying this game.

7.5/10

review:
Alright time to update this review from the crappy place holder I had for years.

Far Cry 4 is a strong improvement upon Far Cry 3. Gameplay, graphics, co-op, just about everything in Far Cry 4 is more fun than it was in Far Cry 3. Except the story.

Don't get me wrong, the Far Cry 4 story is still great. Pagen Min is a fantastic villain (Troy Baker, is a literal GOD). But the story of Far Cry 3 did a far better job at captivating me than Far Cry 4. It took me years to finally get around to beating the storyline. However I will say that the ending of Far Cry 4 was superb, and waaaay better than the ending to Far Cry 3, which many remember as being a let down. 

With that being said, the storyline is the only thing that I feel isn't way better than Far Cry 3. This game is an improvement in every single way, and I definitely believe it is worth the buy.
